Mtengo wa mkate unachoka pa ma dolazi okwana 1.49 kufika pa 1.84,  Nyama ya n''gombe inachoka pa ma dolazi okwana 3.35 kufika pa 5.22

eng: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
nya: Mitengo ya mafuta inakweranso.  Ku Harare mtengo pa lita mtengo unakwera kuchoka pa ma dolazi okwana 1.41 kufika 1.69 kuchoka Lachiwiri kufika Lachitatu.

eng: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
nya: Kukwera kwa mitengo ya zakudya ndi komwe kunachititsa kukwera mitengo kwa ogula zinthu mu dziko la  Aigupto (Egypt), inakwera kufika pa  8.8 % mwezi wa Febuluwale. Kukwera kwachangu mu zaka zitatu, malinga ndi ziwerengero za nthambi ya CAPMAS.

eng: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
nya: A Cudjoe anati zinali zovuta kwa maboma  ndi madera ngati a African Union kuti apange njira zodzitetezera podzathandizira anthu ogula zinthu mu nyengo ya kusatsimikizika kwa chuma.

eng: Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food, said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
nya: Ngakhale kutamangidwa chitetezo  mu njira yopeleka chakudya," anatero a Cudjoe poonjezera, "Ndikulingalira dziko la Nigeria, linakakhala ndi njira yake bwezi likugulitsa chakudya  ku maiko ambiri motsika mtengo panopa."

eng: There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world.
nya:
Pakuyenera kukhala changu chodzimangira chitetezo, ndalama zoti zitha kutisunga-zotipewetsa kuwonongeka ku kusatsimikizidwa kwa  zinthu zochitika pa dzilo lonse.
Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
column3: A Chibamba kanyama, oona zachuma mu mzinda wa Lusaka ku Zambia, anati kuchotsa misonkho ya mafuta chitha kukhala chinthu choyenera kuchita panopa ndi nyengoyi poteteza anthu ogula ndi mafakitale.

eng: African governments must find a way of responding, he said. 'It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
nya: Maiko a dera la Afilika akuyenera kupeza  njira yolowelerapo, iwo anatero.  Ali ndi chisankho chotsitsa misonkho kuti atsitse mitengo yazinthu kapena kusiya mitengo yomweyo ndi kugwiritsa ntchito ndalama za boma kuti atsitse mitengo kwa anthu ofuna chithandizo.

eng: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
nya: Koma a Kanyama anapereka maganizo oti zovuta za maiko zomwe zikuchitika pakati pa Russia ndi Ukraine amene ali maiko ogulitsa katundu ku Afilika, zitha kupereka mwayi ochuluka  kwa opanga zinthu zosiyanasiyana ku Afilika.

eng: Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine, Kanyama said.
nya: Maiko ogulitsa zinthu ngati South Africa, amene ali ndi machitidwe amakina amphamvu, atha kupeza mwayi wotumiza kunja zithu ngati  tirigu, ndi zina zomwe asiya mpata a maiko a Russia ndi Ukraine," anatero a Kanyama.

eng: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.
nya: A kanyama anatinso thandizo lochokera ku gulu lonse la dziko lapansi mwachitsanzo ngongole kwa maiko ena aku Afilika ndilolandiridwa.

eng: He noted that the Group of 20 – which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union – "is trying to offer some debt relief."
nya: Iwo anazindikira magulu makumi awiri a maiko a mafakitale ochuluka, maiko ena a chuma chochuluka msanga, ndi  Mgwirizano wa maiko a ku Ulaya, "ukuyesa kupereka thandizo la ngongole."

eng: Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis, Kanyama added.
nya: Maiko ena ngati Zambia a kukonzanzo ndondomeko yawo ya ngongole ndi pologalamu ya IMF imene kwa ineyo ndi njira yokhayo yotulukira mavutowa," anatero a Kanyama.

eng: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
nya: Nkhani iyi idachokera ku VOA  English-to-Africa service, ndi thandizo lochokera kwa otumikira a ku  Zimbabwe.

eng: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
nya: Bungwe la WHO lati Katemera wa COVID ku africa anakwera ndi anthu 15 pa anthu 100 ena alionse(15%) mu mwezi wa February

eng: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
nya: Bungwe la World Health Organisation lati katemera wa COVID 19 ku Africa anakwera ndi anthu 15 pa anthu 100 alionse (15%) pakati pa mwezi wa January ndi February

eng: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year. The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe likukhazikitsa ntchito yolimbikitsa katemera m'dziko lawo lonse "National vaccination blitz" yomwe cholinga chake n'cholimbikitsa omwe sanabayitse katemera m'dzikoli lomwe vuto lokana kubayitsa linali lalikulu chiyambireni ntchitoyi chaka chatha. Ntchitoyi ikulimbikitsidwa malingana ndi kukwera kwa chiwerengero cha anthu opezeka ndi kachilombo ka COVID 19. Dr. Matshidiso Moeti omwe ndi  regional director wa WHO ku Africa mu mawu ake anati kukwera kwa kubayitsa kwa katemera wa COVID-19 kunalimbikitsidwa makamaka chifukwa cha ntchito zofalitsa uthengawu mu mayiko omwe ali ndi chiwerengero cha anthu ambili kumbaphatikizirapo mayiko a Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya ndi Nigeria

eng: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
nya: Dr. Thierno Balde, omwe ndi regional COVID-19 incident manager wa WHO ku Africa wati anthu a mu kontinentiyi akhalebe atcheru

eng: We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible. We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally. The situation might change. So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination, Balde said.
nya:
Taona zomwe zikuchitika ku China, komanso kuopsa kokhala ndi machitidwe ena ofananizidwa ndi kachilomboka, mitundu ina ya kachilomboka yomwe ili ndi kuthekera kwakupezeka
The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month. 	WHO inati pofuna kuthandizira kuvomerezedwa kwa kamtemera wa COVID 19, ilo komanso ma bungwe ena amathandizira kubayitsa kwa namtindi wa anthu mu mayiko osankhidwa osachepera 10 ndi cholinga chofikira anthu 100 miliyoni pakutha pa mwezi wa mawa
Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind. 	Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu amene akugwilizira mpando wa nduna ya zofalitsa nkhani anatidziko lake silitsalira pa mbuyo
Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date. The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
column3: pokhadzana ndi ndondomeko ya kubaya katemera, pochokera pa 15 March 2022 kufikira tsiku la lero, anthu okwana 159, 628 analandira kubayitsa kwa chitatu kwa katemerayu. Ntchito yakubayitsa katemera mu dziko lonse wotchedwa 'National vaccination blitz' uyamba pa 21 March 2022 ndipo boma likulimbikitsa omwe sanabayitse kuti atengerepo mwayi pa ntchitoyi anatero Ndlovu

eng: A number of Zimbabweans have refused vaccination, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines. The country has lately recorded a rise in new infections – now cumulatively at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.
nya: Mzika zambili za Zimbabwe zakana kulandira katemerayu pachifukwa chakuti iwo sakumuona bwino katemera yemwe anapatsidwa kwa iwo yemwe anapangidwa ku China, sinopharm ndi Sinova. Kutengera zotsatila zomwe zinapezedwa ndiJohns Hopkins University pakatipa, omwe akupanga namlondora wa matenda obuka pa dziko lonse, chiwelengero cha odwala mtundu wa tsopano wa COVID 19 mu dzikoli chakwera kufikira 244,012 kuphatikizira imfa za anthu 5,418.

eng: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, attributes that to the recent lifting of restrictive measures, such as lockdowns. He says, however, it is not time to panic, just to enforce WHO protocols, such masking and social distancing.
nya: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete omwe ndi wamkulu wa Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians wati izi zili choncho kamba ka kuchotsa kwa njira zocheptsera kafalikira kwa matendawa monga kutseka kwa zipata zolowera m'dzikolo. Iye wati, komabe,sikoyenera kuti anthu akhale ndi mantha koma kulimbikitsa kutsatira njira za WHO monga kuvala zotchinga kukwama ndi kukhala motalikilana.

eng: After relaxing measures, it is expected that cases will slightly go up. But I also think that it is too early to make any meaningful conclusions, I think it is just an opportunity for us to strengthen our preventative measures and continue highlighting to the rest of the population that COVID is still with us. The good news, though, is that severe cases have not gone up. What we need to do is to continue to get vaccinated and what is important is that the government should – as it is doing – is monitor these numbers. There is no cause for alarm or cause for us to introduce new measures, Chimbetete said.
nya: chifukwa chakukhwefura njira zopwera, kukuyembekezedwa kuti chiwelengero cha odwala chikwera pang'ono. Koma ndikuganiza kuti sitingaphere mkota mwamsanga ngati pakali pano. Ndikuona kuti ndi mwayi wathu kuti tilimbitse njira zopewera komanso kutsindika kwa mzika zathu kuti COVID 19 tikanali naye. Komabe nkhani yabwino ndi yakuti matenda odwala kwambili sakukwera chiwerengero. Chomwe tikufunika kuchita ndi kupitiliza kulandira katemera komanso boma lipitilize kuyang'anira chiwerengero monga mowe likuchitira. Palibepo chobweretsa mantha komanso chotipangitsa kuoeza njira zina, anatero Chimbetete.

eng: Zimbabwe had a target of vaccinating at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a figure that some say was difficult to reach given the scarcity of resources and hesitance. It has yet to announce when it plans to achieve herd immunity.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe limafuna kupeleka katemera jwa anthu osachepera 10 million pakutha kwa chaka chatha, chiwerengero chomwe ena mati n'chovuta kuchikwanilitsa potengera kusowa kwa zipangizo zofunikira komanso kuzengereza. Likuyembekezedwa kuti lilengeze chikonzero chake kuti ikwanilitse kupima kapena kusakhudzika ndi matendawa.

eng: Finland Crowned World's Happiest Nation for Fifth Year
nya: Finland ivekedwa kukhala dziko lokondwetsetsa kwa chaka cha chisanu pa dziko lonse la pansi

eng: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year running, in an annual U.N.-sponsored index that again ranked Afghanistan as the unhappiest, followed closely by Lebanon.
nya: Finland yatchulidwa kukhara dziko lokondwetsetsa paziko lonse lapansi kwa zaka zisanu zotsogozana, Mu nsonkhano wa pachaka othandizidwa ndi UN waonetsanso kuti Afghanistan ndi dziko losakondwetsetsa pa dziko lonse lapansi motsatirana  pafupifupi ndi dziko la Lebanon.

eng: Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania recorded the biggest boosts in wellbeing. The largest falls in the World Happiness table, released on Friday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.
nya: Serbia, Bulgaria ndi Romania awonetsa kukhara maiko omwe apititsa patsogolo kwambiri pakakhalidwe kabwino ka anthu. Kutsika kwakukulu mu mndandanda wa kukondwera, zomwe zatulutsidwa Lachisanu, wachitika ku Lebanon, Venuzuela komanso Afghanistan.

eng: Lebanon, which is facing economic meltdown, fell to second from last on the index of 146 nations, just below Zimbabwe.
nya: Lebanon yomwe ikukumana ndimavuto akuonongeka kwa zachuma, yafika pachiwiri kwa omaliza mukaundula wa maiko 146, pamusi pake pali Zimbabwe.

eng: War-traumatized Afghanistan, already bottom of the table, has seen its humanitarian crisis deepen since the Taliban took power again last August.  U.N. agency UNICEF estimates one million children under five could die of hunger this winter if not aided.
nya: Afghanistan, dziko lomwe lazunzika ndi nkhondo lomwe lili kale pansi pa mndandanda, zaonekera kulowa pansi kwakukulu kwa kakhalidwe kabwino kapena thanzi la anthu awo kuchokela nthawi yomwe matalibani anatenganso ulamuliro kachikena mu August wapitayu. U.N. agency UNICEF anayelekezera kuti ana osapyora zaka zisanu okwana 1 miliyoni akanatha kufa ndi njala mnyengo yozizirayi akanapanda kuthandizidwa.

eng: This (index) presents a stark reminder of the material and immaterial damage that war does to its many victims, co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said. The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's own assessment of their happiness, as well as economic and social data.
nya: Mumulingo umenewu ukuimilira kukumbutsa mmene mulungo unalili wa zipangizo komanso zomwe sizipangizo zomwe nkhondo inachita kwa okhudzidwa, co-author  Jan-Emmanuel De Neve  anatero. The World Happiness Report, pano muchaka chawo chachikhumi, ikutengera paziganizo za anthu pachimwemwe chawo, chimodzimodzi pazachuma komanso kakhalidwe kawo

eng: It assigns a happiness score on a scale of zero to 10, based on an average of data over a three-year period. This latest edition was completed before the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
nya: Inapeleka mulingo wachisangalalo pamulingo wa ziro mpaka 10, kutengera pa mulingo wakaundula  wa nthawi yoposa zaka zitatu,zomwe zinalembedwa zatsopanozi zinamalizidwa  dziko la Russia ndi Ukrain asana ukilane.

eng: Northern Europeans once again dominated the top spots -- with the Danes second behind the Finns, followed by the Icelandic, the Swiss and the Dutch. The United States rose three places to 16th, one ahead of Britain, while France climbed to 20th, its highest ranking yet.
nya: Anthu aku Northen europe anapambananso kachikena  pamalo apa mwamba ndi Danes achiwiri pambuyo pa Finns, motsatirana ndi Icelandic, Swiss ndi Dutch.Dziko la United States anakwera  ndi malao atatau kufika pa 16th, patsogolo ndi  mulingo umodzi kwa Britain, pamene France  inakwera kufika pa 20th, mulingo waku waukulu pakali pano.

eng: As well as a personal sense of wellbeing, based on Gallup polls in each country, the happiness score takes account of GDP, social support, personal freedom and levels of corruption.
nya: Kuphatikizapo kuti ngati munthu amene zinthu zake zilibwino, kutengera maganizo a anthu mu dziko lina lililonse,  kupambana kwa chisangalaro kumatengera  kuwelengera GDP, kuthandizilidwa ndi ma ubale, ufulu wa munthu  komanso mlingo wa katangale

eng: This year the authors also used data from social media to compare people's emotions before and after the Covid-19 pandemic. They found "strong increases in anxiety and sadness" in 18 countries but a fall in feelings of anger.
nya: Chaka chino, oyambitsawo anagwiritsiranso ntchito data pa tsamba la mchezo la intaneti kuti asiyanitse maimvaima a m'malingaliro mlili wa Covid usanafike komanso utafika. Iwo anapeza "kukula kwa nkhawa komanso kukhumudwa" mu mayiko 18 koma kutsika mu mkwiyo.

eng: The lesson of the World Happiness Report over the years is that social support, generosity to one another and honesty in government are crucial for wellbeing, report co-author Jeffrey Sachs wrote.
nya: Phunziro la uthenga opezeka mu World Hapinness Report pakudutsa kwa zaka ndilakuti kuthandiza pa maubale, kupeleka kwa wina ndi mzake komanso kuona mtima mu mboma  n'kofunika pa kukhala bwino kwa munthu. olemba nawo uthenga wa mu ripoti Jeffrey Sachs analemba.

eng: World leaders should take heed.
nya: Azitsogoleri adziko akuyenera amve

eng: The report raised some eyebrows when it first placed Finland at the top of its listings in 2018.
nya: Zotsatira  zinadzidzimutsa pomwe Finland inaikidwa pamwamba mu 2018

eng: Many of the Nordic country's 5.5 million people describe themselves as taciturn and prone to melancholy, and admit to eyeing public displays of joyfulness with suspicion.
nya: Anthu ambili a mu chiwerengero cha 5.5 million ochokera kumayiko a Finland, Iceland ndiScandinavia anazifotoza okha kukhala osayankhurayankhura ndi osavuta kuvutika ndi kukhumudwa, komanso anavomereza kuti amayang'ana kuonetsera kwa chimwemwepagulu la anthu ndi chikaiko.

eng: But the country of vast forests and lakes is also known for its well-functioning public services, ubiquitous saunas, widespread trust in authority and low levels of crime and inequality.
nya: Koma dziko la nkhalango ndi nyanja zikuluzikulu limadziwikanso ndi ntchito za boma zogwira ntchito bwino, malo osambira mthunzi opezeka paliponse, kukhulupilidwa kwa adindo ndi anthu ambilikomanso chiwerengero cha milandu ndi kuyanjanitsa kochepa.

eng: Zimbabwe Court Orders Trial for NY Times Freelancer
nya: Bwalo la milandu ku Zimbabwe lalamula kufufuzanso mtolankhani wa NY Times .

eng: A court in Zimbabwe dismissed a discharge application Tuesday in a case against a New York Times journalist. Freelance journalist Jeffrey Moyo is accused of flouting Zimbabwe's immigration laws when he allegedly helped two foreign reporters enter the southern African nation illegally last year.
nya: Bwalo la milandu ku dziko la Zimbabwe linakana pempho lakutuluka lachiwiri mu mlandu wa mtolankhaniwa New York Times.Mtolankhani wozilempha yekha Jeffrey Moyo akuimbidwa mlandu wokana moonekera lamulo bungwe loona za anthu olowa ndi otula la ku Zimbabwe pamene akuganiziridwa kuti anathandizira atolankhani a kunja kwa dzikoli kulowa dziko la kummawakwa Africa li chaka chatha.

eng: Kathleen Mpofu — one of Moyo's lawyers — said the journalist will go on trial April 28.
nya: Kathleen Mpofu - m'modzi mwa oyimira mlandu wa  Moyo - wati mtolankhaniyu akaonekera ku khothi kukayankha mlandu pa 28 April.

eng: The magistrate dismissed the application. He basically found that the state had led enough evidence for Mr. Moyo to be put to his defense and coming to this finding, Mpofu told VOA from Bulawayo, via WhatsApp.
nya: Oweluza mlandu, a magistrate,anakana pempho lawo. Kunali kovuta kuwateteza abambo Moyo kamba odandaura anabweretsa umboni wokwanira Ampofu anaauza VOAkuchokeraku Bulawayo podzera mauthenga a inteneti a WhatsApp

eng: It seems the magistrate relied on the fact that the state had led the evidence of the allegedly false accreditation cards that had been obtained by the foreign journalist and based on his interpretation of the evidence led by the state, he found that it was sufficient to put the accused to his defense.
nya:
Zikuonetsa kuti a magistrate anadalira umboni omwe odandaula anapeleka okhudzana ndi mapepala achilolezo abodza omwe mtolankhaniyu anali nawo komanso potengera kutanthauzira kwa umboniwu,  anapeza kuti kunali koyenera kuteteza odandaulidwayu.
Moyo's lawyers believed the case might be dismissed, after the same court earlier this month acquitted a Zimbabwe Media Commission official, Thabang Manhika, for allegedly processing fake accreditations for two South Africa-based New York Times journalists who entered Zimbabwe and were later deported. Moyo and Manhika were being tried separately. 	Oyimilira mlandu wa Moyo anakhulupilira kuti mlanduwu uthakutsekedwa, potsatira ndi pamene bwalo la milandu koyambilira kwa mwezi uno linamasura ogwira ntchito ku Media Commission ya ku Zimbabwe, Thabang Manhika, yemwe amaganizilidwa kuti anathandizira kupanga zilolezo za bodza kwa atolankhani awiri a Newyork Times omwe amakhala mu dziko la South Africa omwe analowa mu dziko la Zimbabwe ndipo anatumizidwa kwawo. Moyo ndi Manhika amayankha milandu yawo mosiyana.
Zimbabwe's government says both Moyo and Manhika broke immigration laws. 	Boma la Zimbabwe lati Moyo  komanso Manhika onse anaphwanya lamulo la bungwe loona za anthu otuluka ndi olowa mdziko.
Information Ministry Permanent Secretary Ndabaningi Nick Mangwana commented on Tuesday's ruling. 	Mlembi wokhazikika wa unduna wa zofalitsa nkhani Ndabaningi Nick anaikirapo ndemanga pachigamulo cha la chiwiri.
We just want to see that there's law and order. If somebody has committed a crime or is perceived, they will have their day in court, so he is having his day in court, so his outcome is not in our hands, it's in the hands of the criminal justice system. That's our position," Mangwana said.
column3:
ife tikungofuna kuonetsetsa kuti pali lamulo ndi dongosolo. Ngati wina wapalamula mulandu kapena akukayikilidwa, adzakhala ndi tsiku lawo mu bwalo lamilandu ndipo zotstira zawo sizili mmanja mwathu,zili mmanja mwa dongosolo la chilungamo ndi milandu.
Tabani Moyo of the Media Institute of Southern Africa, or MISA, has called for the journalist to be treated fairly. 	Tabani Moyo wogwira ntcito ku Media Institute of Southern Africa,kapena kuti MISA, waitanira kuti mtolankhaniyu achite naye mwa chilungamo
MISA Zimbabwe underscores the need for fair trial. That is our position throughout till the end of the case. All we are saying is that he, just like any other citizen, deserves a fair trial," Moyo said.
column4: MISA  Zimbabwe yatsindika za kufunika kwa kuyesa oganizilidwa mlandu mwa chilungamo. Uwo ndiye udindo wathu  njira yonse mpaka pothera mlanduwu. Chomwe tikunena ndichakutiiye, monga mzika ili onse, akuyenera kupatsidwa mwai wakuyesedwa mwa chilungamo,.

eng: Moyo, a Zimbabwean national, faces up to 10 years in prison if convicted.
nya: Moyo, mbadwa ya dziko la zimbabwe, izakakhala kundende kwa dzaka 10 ngati itapezeka yolakwa.

eng: Zimbabwe Police Block Main Opposition Rallies
nya: Apolisi a dziko la Zimbabwe aletsa misokhani ya chipani chotsutsa chachikulu.

eng: Zimbabwe police Saturday blocked the country's main opposition party from holding rallies ahead of March 26 elections to fill seats that have fallen vacant since the general election in 2018. The police says the rally ban in Mavhunga, about 80 kilometers east of Harare, is meant to ensure peace and stability.
nya: A police  ku Zimbabwe anatchinga  chipani chotsutsa chachikulu m'dzikomo kupangitsa misokhano yokhudzana ndi zisakho zobwera pa 26 march pa mipando yomwe ilibe adindo chichitikileni chisankho chachikulu mu 2018. Apolisi ati akaniza ku mavhunga, komwe ndi pafupifupi 80 kilomitazi ku mmawa kwa Harare. akufuna kuonetsetsa kuti pali mtendere komanso bata.

eng: Police camped overnight Friday at a venue in Marondera, where the leader of Zimbabwes main opposition, the Citizens Coalition for Change, Nelson Chamisa, was supposed to address his supporters Saturday. The 44-year-old candidate later came to disperse the crowd waiting for him.
nya: Apolisi anakakhalira kumalo komweko usiku wa Lachisanu mu Marondera, komwe mtsogoleri wotsutsa wa Zimbabwe anali, gulu la  Citizens Coalition for Change,  Nelson Chamisa amayenera kuwayankhura anthu owatsatira Loweluka.

eng: We are a party of peace, a party of the rule of law, he said.
nya: Ndife chipani cha mtendere, chipani chokhala pa lamuro, anatero.

eng: Chamisa said his party does not want to fight with people. He said the government denied permission to hold a rally, so the party asked for permission to come and tell about that. He told his supporters he does not want the politics of Zimbabwe to cause any death. Then he added that what the government does not know is that here in Marondera, his arrival is good enough.
nya: Chimisa wati chipani chake sichifuna zolimbana ndi anthu. Wati boma linakaniza chilolezo chopangitsira msonkhano ,ndipo chipani chinapempha chilolezo kuti abwere  kuti azafotokoze za chimenechi, Iye anafotokozera omutsatira kuti sakufuna kuti ndale zakuzimbabwe zipangitse imfa ina iliyonse. Ndipo Iye anaonjezera kuti chomwe Boma silikudziwa ndichakuti kuti kuno ku mombera, kufika iye ndikokwanira.

eng: In an interview Sunday, Fadzayi Mahere, the Citizens Coalition for Change spokeswoman said her party was not happy with the bias of the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission and the police in favor of the ruling ZANU-PF.
nya: Mukucheza nawo Lamulungu,  Fadzayi Mahere yemwe ndi woyankhulira wachizimayi wa bungwe la Citizen Coliation for Change wati chipani chake sichinali chokondwa ndi kusachita bwino komwe bungwe loyendetsa zisankho laku Zimbabwe komanso achitetezo apolisi amakondera chipani cholamura cha ZANU-PF.

eng: Our rally in Marondera was purportedly banned and yet ZANU-PF was car rally and other unsanctioned in the very same area, she said. "Not once have they sought authorization or given notice to the police, yet these unlawful prohibitions are meted out against us. Ours is a struggle of non-violent resistance. However, the thousands that came out just to hear president Chamisa speak shows beyond any doubt that the citizens are prepared to do whatever it takes to reclaim their dignity. We continue to urge supporters to register to vote in their masses so that we attain our target in 2023: A landslide victory."
nya: Msonkhano wathu unapitilira kukanizidwa pamene ZANU-PF  galimoto yawo ya msonkhano ndikuchita zina zosaloledwa mudera lomwelo, "iye  anatero. "olo kamodzi sanapepheko chilolezo olo kudziwitsa azachitetezo apolisi, pomwe  kuphhwanya lamulo kumeneku amkchitira ife. kwa ife ndikuthandizira anthu abata amuderalo. Chomcho mazana omwe anatuluka kuti akamve mtsogoleri wadziko Chimisa akuyankhura panalibe  kukaika kwina kulikonse kuti  mbadwa za dziko zakomzeka kuchita chilichonse chomwe angachite pakubwezeletsanso ulemu wawo. tinapitilirabe kupempha.

eng: Zimbabwe police Sunday refused to comment on the ban of the Citizens Coalition for Change in Marondera. It issued a letter to the opposition saying it needed time to prepare to ensure there was peace at the rally. Two weeks ago, violence instigated by suspected ruling ZANU-PF supporters at a Citizens Coalition for Change rally resulted in two deaths and dozens injured.
nya: okhwimitsa chitetezo a dziko la Zimbabwe akana kuikirapo ndemanga pa kuletsa  Citizen Coliation for Change mu Marondera. Anapereka kalata kwa otsutsa kuti amkafuna nthawi kuti akomzekere kuti awonetsetse kuti kunali mtendere m'nthawi  ya misokhano. Sabata ziwiri zapitazo kunali ziwawa zomwe zinatsogoleledwa ndi otsatira omwe akukaikilIdwa achipani cholamura cha ZANU-PF ku msonkhano wa Citizens for Coliation Change zadzetsa imfa za anthu awiri komanso kuvulara kwa anthu khumi ndi awiri.

eng: Alexander Rusero, a former senior politics lecturer at Harare Polytechnic college, says police and political parties must thwart violence at opposition rallies.
nya: Alexander Rusero yemwe ndi mphuzitsi wamkulu wa ndale wakale pa sukulu yaukachenjede ya Harare Polytechnic, wati okhwimitsa chitetezo komanso zipani zandale  zikuyenera kuthetsa ziwawa pamisonkhano yaotsutsa

eng: Police have arrested 16 suspected ZANU-PF supporters who are accused of causing the violence and who now face murder charges in connection with the deaths at the opposition rally.
nya: Okhwimitsa chitetezo amanga anthu 16 otsatira chipani cha ZANU-PF omwe akuganizilidwa ndikuzengedwa kuti anayambitsa ziwawa ndipo akuyankha mulandu wakupha molumikizana ndi imfa zomwe zachitika ku misonkhano ya otsutsa.

eng: Zimbabwes pre-election season has been marred by violence that has claimed lives and left thousands injured since 2000 after a strong opposition party emerged.
nya: Nyengo yoyandikira zisankho kunadzadza ndi ziwawa zomwe anthu anamwalirapo komanso ambili anavulala kuchokera 2000 pamene chipani chotsutsa cha mphamvu chinauka

eng: A Zimbabwe Court Dismisses Suspension of Striking Teachers
nya: Bwalo la milandu ku Zimbabwe lachotsa kuimitsidwa kwa ntchito kwa miyezi itatukwa amphunzitsi omwe amanyanyala ntchito za boma.

eng: Zimbabwe's High Court has voided the government's three-month suspension of striking teachers, ruling the ministry of education overstepped its authority. The teachers went on strike last week over poor salaries just as schools were set to reopen after a long break due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Analysts say children's education has been caught in the crossfire.
nya: Bwalo lalikulu la milandu la Zimbabwe lachotsa kuimitsidwa pa ntchito kwa miyezi itatu kwaaphunzitsi omwe amanyanyala ntchito ndi boma, kulamulira kuti unduna wa za maphunziro unadutsa malire a mphamvu zake. Aphunzitsiwa anapanga zionetsero posagwira ntchito sabata yathayi chifukwa cha kusakhutitsidwa ndi malipiro awo monga momwe ma sukulu akuyenera kutsegulilidwanso patatha kuima kwa nthawi yayitali chifukwa cha mlili wa COVID 19. Maphunziro a ana akumanizana ndi moto kuwiri.

eng: Zimbabwes High Court has ruled the suspension of striking teachers by Evelyn Ndlovu, Zimbabwes minister of primary and secondary education, was illegal.
nya: Bwalo la milandu lalikulu ku Zimbabwe lagamula kuti kuimitsa ntchito aphunzitsi omwe amapanga zionetsero pa  kusagwira ntchito yawo komwe a Evelyn Ndlovu, omwe ndi nduna ya maphunziro a pulayimale komanso sekondale anachita, ndikosavomerezeka pa malamulo.

eng: Noble Chinhanu of the Zimbabwe Human Rights NGO Forum represented the teachers in court.
nya: A Noble Chinhanu ochokera kubungwe loona za ufulu wa anthu la, Zimbabwe Human Rights Forum anaimilira aphunzitsiwa ku bwalo la milandu

eng: We managed to present our arguments before the court and the judge has given us an order to the effect that the press statement that was issued by the minister of primary and secondary education is illegal and unconstitutional, said Chinhanu. "We managed to prove that our client has a right not to be suspended in such a manner which was in violation of public service regulations of the nation."
nya: Tinakwanitsa kupeleka mfundo zathu mu bwalo lamilandu ndipo oweruza milandu watipatsa lamulo lomwe lapangitsa uthenga womwe unapelekedwa ndi nduna ya zamaphunziro a pulayimale ndi sekondale unali wosavomerezekandi malamulo, anatero a Chinhanu. "Tinakwantsa kuonetsera kuti omwe timawaimilira pa mlanduwu ali ndi ufulu wakuti asayimitsidwe motero komwe kudali kuphwanyandondomeko za ogwira ntchito za boma mu dzikoli."

eng: Government officials have not commented on the court ruling.
nya: Ogwira nchito ku ma ofesi a boma sanaikirepo ndemanga pa chigamulo ca bwalo lamilanduchi

eng: Schools in Zimbabwe closed last year during the COVID-19 pandemic and had been due to reopen last week.
nya: Masukulu ku Zimbabwe anatsekedwa chifukwa cha Mlili wa COVID 19 ndipo amayembekezerekakuti atsekulilidwe sabata yathayi.

eng: Gibson Nyikadzino, an independent political analyst, says the government and teachers must settle the strike quickly because students continue to be the losers.
nya: A Gibson Nyikadzino, ochitilapo ndemanga pankhani za ndale oima paokha, ati boma ndi aphunzitsi athetse kuima kwa kuphunzitsaku mwa nsanga chifukwa ophunzira ndi omwe angapitilire kuvutika.

eng: We are seeing a lot of agitation and politicization of this from the employees, said Nyikadzino. "They are not keen to listen to what the employer is saying. Their parties that are being affected as a result of this, so what has to be done is go to the tripartite negotiating forum and in the spirit find a consensus."
nya: Tikuona kuti pachuluka kukhumudwa komanso kulowetsapo ndale pa izi kuchokera kwa ogwirantchito, anatero Nyikadzino. "Alibe chidwi kuti amvetsere zomwe owalemba ntchito akunena. Pali ma gulu amene akukhudzika kamba ka izi, ndiye chimene chikuyenera kuchitika ndi kupita kukapanga zokambilana zokhudza magulu atatu ndi mtima wokuti agwilizane chinthu chimodzi."

eng: The tripartite he refers to is the government, the workers and private companies.
nya: Utatu womwe akukamba ndi boma,ogwira ntcito komanso pa kampani omwe si a boma.

eng: Sifiso Ndlovu from the Zimbabwe Teachers Association – the countrys largest teachers union – says educators want to return to work, but need more pay to sustain themselves.
nya: A Sifiso Ndlovu ochokera ku bungwe la Zimbabwe Teachers Association lomwe ndi bungwe lalikulu pa mabugwe onse a mgwilizano wa aphunzitsi, wati akatswili pa maphunzirowa akufuna kubwerera ku ntchito koma akufuna ndalama zawo za malipiro zikwezedwe kuti azizisamalira okha.

eng: There are some members who are unable to travel: those who are far distant schools. They are finding it difficult because of the resources, said Ndlovu. "And there are some who are saying while we are within the school environs, we still find it difficult to find food for subsistence. That is what is mitigating against 100 percent attendance. We hope that after pay day (next week Tuesday) things will get back to normal. But that does not mean that the teachers are happy with the remuneration that they are getting. They still want some more."
nya: Pali ena omwe amakanika kuyenda: iwo omwe amachokera ku ma sukulu akutali. Iwo akuvutka chifukwa cha kusowa kwa zipangizozi, anatero Ndlovu. "Komanso pali ena omwe akuti akamakhala kufupi ndi kusukulu zawozo amavutika kupeza chakudya cha tsiku ndi tsiku. Izi ndizomwe zikumawakanikitsa kupezeka nthawi zonse.Tikukhulupira kuti tikalandira malipiro sabata la mawa la chiwiri zinthu zibwerera m'chimake. Komabe izi sizikutanthauza kuti aphunzitsiwa ndi okondwa ndi ndalama zowe amalandira. AKufunabe kuonjezeredwa malipiro."

eng: Taungana Ndoro, is the spokesman for Zimbabwes ministry of primary and secondary education and says the situation in schools now is "encouraging."
nya: Taungana Ndoro, ndi oyankhulira unduna wa maphunziro  a pulaimale ndi sekondale ndipo wati zinthu mu masukulu tsopano zili molimbikitsa.

eng: We have gone round in government and non-government schools, and we are quite impressed by the teaching and learning that is going on, Ndoro said. "Of course there are a few schools here and there which still face a bit of challenges."
nya: Tayendera masukulu a boma komanso omwe si aboma, ndipo ndife okhutitsidwa  ndi momwe kuphunzitsa komanso kuphunzira kukuchitikira, anatero Ndoro. "ndi zoona kuti pali ma sukulu ena patalipatali omwe akukumana ndizopinga pang'ono."

eng: The pay dispute goes back to October 2018, when the government stopped paying civil servants in U.S. dollars, switching to the reintroduced Zimbabwean dollar. The new currency has steadily lost value, effectively reducing teacher wages to about $100 a month. The teachers want the $540 a month they were getting in 2018.
nya: Nkhani ya malipiro ikuchokera mu October chaka cha 2018 pamene boma linasiya kulipira ogwira ntchito m'boma kudzera mu ndalama za kunja za U.S dollar kubwerera ku ndalama ya ku Zimbabwe ya Zimbawean dollar. Ndalama yatsopanoyi yakhala ikutsika mphamvu pang'ono ndi pang'ono, zomwe zinapangitsa kuti ndalama yomwe aphunzitsi amalandira itsike kufikira pa $100 pa mwezi. Aphunzitsiwa akufuna adzilandira $540 yomwe ankalandira mu chaka cha 2018

eng: Last week the teachers rejected the governments offer of a 20 percent pay raise along with some incentives, such as housing loans.
nya: Sabata yatha aphunzitsiwa adakana ganizo la boma kui akweze ndi $20 pa $100 iliyonse mophatikizapo zolimbikitsira zina monga ngongole za nyumba

eng: Zimbabwe Government Orders Vaccinated Workers Back to Work
nya: Boma laZimbabwe lalamula ogwira ntchito omwe analandira katemera kubwerera ku ntchito

eng: Zimbabwes government has ordered civil servants who are vaccinated against COVID-19 to immediately report for duty after more than a year of working from home, citing a declining in new cases of the virus in the country.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe lalamura ogwira ntchito mboma omwe analandira katemera otetezaku mlili wa COVID 19 kuti abwerere kuntchito pompopompo patadutsa nthawi yopitilira chaka yomwe ogwira ntchitowa akhala akugwirira ntchito ku nyumba, poona kuchepa kwa chiwerengerocha anthu atsopano opezekandi kachilombokamu dzikoli.

eng: Authorities also announced any government workers without proof of vaccination will be barred from workplaces and face punishments, including a freeze on their salaries.
nya: Adindo alengezanso kuti aliyense wogwira ntchito m'boma amene alibe umboni woti anabayitsa katemerayu adzayimitsidwa kuti asapite ku malo ogwilira ntchito ndipo adzalandira chilango, kuphatikizapo kusalandira malipiro awo.

eng: In a statement this week, President Emmerson Mnangagwas government said it wants its employees to resume meeting in person.  Late Tuesday, Monica Mutsvangwa, the countrys information minister, said the number of people being hospitalized for COVID-19 is on a steady decline.
nya: Mu mawu ake sabata ino, Presidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa ndi boma lake ati akufuna ogwira ntchito ake ayambe kupezeka. Lachiwiri lapitali,Motswatswa, nduna ya zamauthenga, anati chiwelengero cha anthu ogonekedwa ku chipatala kamba ka COVID 19 chikumka chikutsikira pang'ono ndi pang'ono

eng: This indicates that the national response measures instituted by government continue to pay off. …In view of the continued decline in new cases and deaths, coupled with a declining testing positivity rate that is indicating that the community transmission has gone down, all ports of entry [are to] be reopened, but ensuring that all the recommended COVID-19 prevention measures are adhered to, she said.
nya: Izi zikuonetsetsa kuti njira zothetsera mavuto za dziko zokhazikitsidwa ndi boma zikupindura. …Poona kutsika kopitilira kwa chiwerengero cha anthu atsoano opezeka ndi kachilomboka komanso omwalira, mophatikizana ndi kuchepa kwa kufulumira kwa kupezeka ndi kachilomboka zomwe zikuonetsa kuti kupatsirana mu derali kwatsika, malo onse olowera akuyenera kutsegulidwanso, koma kuonetsetsakuti njira zonse zoyenera kugwilitsidwa ntchito popewera mlili wa COVID 19 zizitsatilidwa, iye anatero

eng: However, the compulsory vaccination rule is not being welcomed by all civil servants.
nya: Choncho njira yakatemera okakamiza sinalandilidwe ndi ogwira ntchito m'boma onse.

eng: Obert Masaraure, the president of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, says the workers will take the matter to court if the government insists.
nya: Obert Masaraure Mtsogoleri wa Almagamated Rural Teachers of Zimbabwe, wati ogwira ntchito atengera nkhaniyi ku bwalo la milandu ngati boma likakamilebe.

eng:
A contract that was signed by civil servants has no provision for mandatory vaccination.  	Mgwirizano omwe unachitika ndiogwira ntchito M'boma mulibemo kukakamiza kubaitsa katemera.
So if the Public Service Commission wants to bar civil servants who are not vaccinated, they are in breach of contract and its unacceptable.  	Ndiye ngati ma ofesi antchito zaboma akufuna kulentsa  ogeira ntchito m'boma omwe sanabayitse iwo akuphwanya mgwirizano wa pangano lawo ndiposizololedwa.
Secondly, civil servants have a right to dignity, they have right to make choices.  	Chachiwiri, ogwira ntchito m'boma ali ndi ufulu ku ulemu wawo, ali ndi ufulu opanga zisankho.
No one can be forced foreign substances to be inserted into their bodies, he noted.
nya: Palibe aliyense angakakamizidwe kulowetsa zinthu zachilendo mmatupi awo, "anaounikira.

eng: Dr. Norman Matara, the head of Zimbabwe Association for Doctors for Human Rights, says his organization has noted that several other countries are moving towards compulsory vaccination.
nya: Dr. Norman Matara, wamkulu wa bungwe lamgwilizano wa ma dokotola la Zimbabwe Association of Doctors for Human Rights wati bungwe lake lazindikira kuti mayiko ambili akulunjika pa nkhani yakubaitsa katemera mokakamiza

eng: It is something that we are strongly against. We think mandating vaccines is something that fuels vaccine hesitance.  	Ndichinthu chomwe tikutsutsana nacho kwambiri. Tikuganiza kuti kukakamiza katemera ndichinthu chomwe chikulimbikitsa kuchedwa kukalandira katemera.
There is a lot of conspiracy theory that goes around when people are saying we are being forced to be vaccinated.
nya: Pali maganizo ambri azachiwembu omwe akuzungulira anthu akanena kuti akukakamizidwa  kubaitsa katemera.

eng: We really have to get the buy in of people: spread the gospel of vaccines, how they work and then encourage people to get vaccinated and not force them to get vaccinated," he pointed out.
nya: Tikuyenera kumvera zonena za anthu,kufalitsa uthenga wa bwino wa katemera, momwe amagwilira ntchito kenakonso kulimbikitsa anthu kuti abayitse katemerayu osati kuwakakamiza kubaitsa katemerayu., iye anatero.

eng: But Sifiso Ndlovu from the Zimbabwe Teachers Association supports the governments position.
nya: Koma a Sifiso Ndlovu ochokera ku Zimbabwe Teachers Association avomerezana ndi maganizo a boma

eng: Definitely, all workers should take up the vaccination.  	mwachidziwikire, ogwira ntchito onse akuyenera abayitse katemera.
Not because they want to protect themselves, but they want to protect their colleagues at work.
nya: izi akupanga osati kuti aziteteze okha koma kuti ateteze anzawo ogwira nawo ntchito

eng: Scientific evidence has it that if you are fully vaccinated it comes with a mild attack.
nya: Umboni wa a sayansi ukuonetsa kuti ngati munthu anabayitsa katemera yense nthendayi ikumabwera ndi mphamvu yochepa

eng: Why not take up that? There is nothing wrong or sinister about it," he said.
nya: Tsono chosabayitsira ndi chiyani? Palibe cholakwika kapena tchimo popanga zimenezi," anatero

eng: About 3.3 million people in Zimbabwe have received two shots of the COVID-19 vaccines, while about 86,000 have received a third jab.
nya: Anthu pafupifupi 3.3 miliyoni abayidwa kawiri katemerayu, pamene anthu pafupifupi 86,000 alandira wachitatu.

eng: A number of Zimbabweans have refused to get vaccinated, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines.
nya: Mzika zambili za ku Zimbabwe zakana kubayidwa katemerayu ponena kuti sakumukhulupilira makamaka katemera wopangidwa ndi mzika zadziko la China wotchedwa Sinopharm ndi Sinovac.

eng: Zimbabwe Government Suspends Striking Teachers
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe laimitsa pa ntchito aphunzitsi omwe amapanga zionetsero

eng: Authorities in Zimbabwe have suspended striking teachers for three months without pay in a dispute that will see most schools remain closed. The teachers went on strike this week over their compensation.
nya: A dindo ku Zimbabwe ayimitsa pa ntchito aphunzitsi omwe amapanga zionetsero kuti akhale miyezi itatu asakulandira malipiro pa kusamvana komwe kutapangitse masukulu ambili kuti akhalebe chitsekere. Aphunzitsiwa anapanga zionetsero pa kuima kugwira ntchito chifukwa cha kufuna kubwezeretsedwa kwa malipiro awo.

eng: Evelyn Ndlovu, Zimbabwes minister of primary and secondary education, said late Thursday that striking teacher have been suspended due to their reluctance to resume work despite the governments offer to give them a 20 percent salary hike and additional incentives.
nya: A Evelyn Ndlovu omwe ndi nduna ya za maphunziro a ku pulayimale ndi sekondale , madzulo a lachinayi anati kunyanyara kwa aphunzitsi kwaimitsidwa  kutengera kuzengeleza kwawo koyambiranso kugwira ntchito  posatengera kuti boma lawaonjezera malipiro awo omwe amalandira ndi 20 pa 100 aliyense.

eng: All officials within the ministry who absented themselves from duty since the opening of schools on 7th February, 2022 have been suspended without pay forthwith for a period of three-month. During this period, members are not to hinder or interfere with any investigations or evidence relating to the alleged misconduct, said Ndlovu. "Appropriate action will be taken against members who abrogate their duties and responsibilities."
nya: Onse ogwira ntchito ku undunawu omwe sanabwere kuntchito kuyambira kutsekulilidwa kwa ma sukulu pa 7 February, 2022 ayimitsidwa kwa miyezi itatu ndipo sadzilandira ndalama. Munthawi imeneyi aliyense sakuyenera kutchinga kapena kusokoneza kufufuza kapena  umboni okhudzana kusachita bwinoku kukuganizilidwaku, anatelo Ndlovu. "Zoyenera kuchita zichitika mustutsana ndi aliyense yemwe sagwira ntchito zawo ndi maudindo awo."

eng: Zimbabwes schools were scheduled to reopen this week after a long break caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. But teachers refused to resume working, asking for a pay increase. They currently earn about $100 a month.
nya: Ma sukulu aku Zimbabwe amayenera kutsekulilidwanso sabata ino patatha nthawi yaitala chifukwa cha mlili wa COVID-19. K oma aphunzitsi anakana kuyambiranso ntchito, akupempha kuonjezeledwa malipiro. Pakali pano akulandira pafupifupi $100 pa mwezi.

eng: The government Tuesday offered them a 20 percent pay increase and other incentives, such as free school fees for their children and loans for housing. But the teachers have rejected that offer as insufficient.
nya: Lachiwiri Boma laonjezera 20 pa 100 aliyense mu malipiro ndi zina zowalimbikitsa, monga maphunziro aulele kwa ana awo komanso ngongole za manyumba. Koma aphunzitsi akana zimenezi kuti ndizosakwanira.

eng: Obert Masaraure, the president of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, told VOA the suspended educators are making an urgent application to the High Court to declare their suspension illegal.
nya: Obert Masaraure, wapampando wa Almagamated Rural Teachers Union for Zimbabwe, anauza VOA kuti kuimitsa ophunzitsa kukupangitsa kupempha bwalo la milandu kwa changu kuti lillengeze kuti kuimitsidwa kwawo sikololedwa ndi lamulo.

eng: Public service regulation clearly articulates clear guidelines on how people can be suspended. We are not in a banana republic where anyone can wake up and make pronouncements which are detached and divorced from the law, said Masaraure. "We note that the minister has withdrawn herself from the law, therefore cannot be able to speak legally on education (matters) because she has acted unconstitutionally by arbitrarily suspending teachers of Zimbabwe. We deem her suspended as she has acted outside the law."
nya: Malamuloa a kagwilidwe ntchito ka m'boma akufotolkozamomveka bwino momwe anthu angayimitsilidwe pa ntchito.  Sitili mu dziko losakhazikika momwe aliyense amangodzuka ndikulengeza zinthu zosalumikizana komanso zosiyana ndi lamulo. anatero Masaraure. " Taona kuti a nduna azzichotatsa okha pa lamulo, choncho sangathe kuyankhura mololezedwa pa nkhani za maphunziro chifukwa achita mosagwirizana ndi lamulo lalikulu la dziko poimitsitsa mwachisawawa aphunzitsi a ku Zimbabwe. Tikuwaimitsa iwo pa ntchito pakuti achita mosemphana ndi lamulo."

eng: The pay dispute goes back to October 2018, when the government stopped paying teachers in U.S. dollars, switching to the reintroduced Zimbabwean dollar. The new currency has steadily lost value, effectively reducing their wages.
nya: Kusamvetsetsana pa nkhani a malipiliro kunayamba mbuyomu mu chaka cha 2018 pamene boma linasiya kulipira aphunzitsi mu ndalama ya ku nja ya Dollar(U.S dollar) kupita kupita ku ndalama ya ku zimbabwe ya dollar (dollar ya Zimbabwe). Ndalama yatsopanoyi yakhala ikutsika mphamvu pang'ono ndipang'ono zomwe zanapangitsa kuchepa kwa ndalama zawo zolandira pakutha pa nthawi.

eng: The Zimbabwe Teachers Association – the instructors biggest union - said it is hoping to meet with government officials soon to discuss the suspensions.
nya: Bungwe la aphuzitsi la zimbabwe la Zimbabwe Teachers Association - mgwilizano waukulu wa ophunzitsawa- llati akuyembekezera kukumana ndi akulu akulu a boma posachedwapa kuti akakambirane za kuimitsidwaku.

eng: Zimbabwe Teachers, Calling Pay Insufficient, Refuse to Teach
nya: Aphunzitsi akuzimbabwe, akudandaula kuchepa kwa malipiro, akukanakuphunzitsa

eng: Many Zimbabwean schools that closed because of the COVID-19 pandemic remain shuttered as teachers refuse to return to the classroom, citing a need for better pay.
nya: Sukulu zambiri ku Zimbabwe zomwe zinatsekedwa kamba ka COVID-19 zinakali zotsekabe pomwe aphunzitsi akukana kubwelera kukaphunzitsa ponena kuti akufuna malipiro abwino.

eng: No media source currently available
nya: Palibe oulutsa nkhani akupezeka pakali pano

eng: The teachers are paid less than $100 a month. The government has offered a 20 percent pay increase and other incentives, but the teachers have rejected that offer as insufficient.
nya: Aphunzitsakulandira ndarama yosaposera $100 pamwezi. Boma laonjezera 20 peresenti pama lipiro awo komanso zolimbikitsa zina, Koma aphunzitsi akana kuti sizikukwanira

eng: Meanwhile, some youths are studying independently. One such student, a 16-year-old, said, "My appeal [to the government] is for a salary increment for teachers so that they come to work, because we arent learning. Its like we are paying fees for nothing. Its so painful as my parents are struggling for it when I am not learning at all."
nya: Pakalipano achinyamata ena akuphunzira paokha, ophunzira wina  wazaka 16 wati," pempho langa ku boma ndikuti awonjezere malipiro a aphunzitsi kuti ayambilenso kugwira ntchito chifukwa sitikuphunzira. Zili ngati kuti tikulipira ndalama zophunzilira popanda chochitika, ndizopweteka pomwe makolo anga akuvutikira ndalamayo pomwe sindikuphunzira kalikonse.

eng: The pay dispute goes back to October 2018, when the government stopped paying teachers in U.S. dollars, switching to the reintroduced Zimbabwean dollar. The new currency has steadily lost value, effectively reducing teachers' wages.
nya: Mkanganowu ukutitengeranso mmbuyo mu mwezi wa october 2018, Nthawi imene boma linasiya kuwalipira aphunzitsi mu ndalama zakunja U.S dollars, kusintha kubwera ku zimbawean dollars. Ndalama yatsopanoyi inatsika mphamvu.zomwe zinapangitsa kuchepetsa malipiro aphunzitsi

eng: Obert Masaraure, president of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, said the instructors want their old salaries restored and that the offer of a 20 percent raise amounted to almost nothing.
nya: Obert Masaure wapamando wa Almagameted Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, wati ophunzitsa akufuna kuti amlipiro awo  akale abwelele ndipo kuonjezera kwawo ndi 20 peresenti ndipafupifipi kuti palibe chomwe apanga.

eng: We asked for the restoration of salaries, which were robbed from us by the government of the day, Masaraure said. "And the message to the government is clear: We need our pre-October 2018 salaries of 540 dollars U.S. We know these shenanigans of adding an extra dollar to our salaries — that does not add up."
nya: Tikupempa kubwezeletsedwa kwa malipiro, komwe kunachotsedwa ndi boma lomwe lilipo leroli, Masaraure aanati, uthengawu ndiomveka bwino kuboma. Tikufuna malipiro athu omwe timalandira mmbuyo mwa october 2018 omwe  amakhara 540 U.S dollars. Tikudziwa kuti awa ofunthawa akuonjezera ma dollars ena ku malipiro athu- zimenezo sizikumveka

eng: Government officials see the ongoing talks in a different light and voice optimism about a successful resolution.
nya: Akuluakulu aboma akuona zomwe zikulankhulidwa mmalo osiysna siyana komanso liwu losakaika lakukonza zinthu bwino.

eng: Paul Mavima, Zimbabwe's minister of public service, labor and social welfare, said, "In many ways we already have a breakthrough. The leaders of the workers have to a very large extent welcomed this package and they are only saying: Lets discuss how it is going to be implemented."
nya: Paul Mavima, nduna ya Zimbabwe ya ntchito za boma ndi sozowa za anthu,inati, " tipeza kubooleza mu njira zambili. Atsogoleri a ogwira ntchito achilandira ichi kwambili ndipo chomwe akunena ndi chakuti:tiyeni tikambilane kuti tichikhazikitsabwanji ichi."

eng: The teachers and government are expected to meet in coming days to resume negotiations. Meanwhile, students wait to resume their studies months after the COVID-19 pandemic forced their schools to close.
nya: Boma ndi aphunzitsi akuyembekezeleka kukumana masiku akubwerawa pakukambirana zakubweleranso, pakalipano ophunzira akuyembekezera kuyambanso maphunziro awo  mezi itatha chifukwa chakukakamizidwa kutsekedwa kwa  sukulu zawo chifukwa cha mulili wa COVID-19

eng: Private Military Contractors Bolster Russian Influence in Africa
nya: Asilikali ankhondo omwe si aboma  a zomanga manga akulimbikitsa machitachita a Russia ku Africa

eng: Russia's geopolitical ambitions in Africa have in recent years been backed by private military contractors, often described as belonging to the "Wagner group" — an entity with no known legal status.
nya: Zokhumba za ndale za Russiah zokhudzana ndi malo a Africa muzaka zapafupipa zalandila kuvomerezedwa ndi ogwira ntchito za usilikali omwe si aboma , omwe nthawi zambili amafotokozedwa ngati ndi gawo limodzi la "gulu la Wagner"- gulu lomwe kulodwa kwake nd lamulo  sikumadziwika

eng: Most recently, Western nations have condemned the alleged arrival of Russian mercenaries in Mali's capital Bamako, a claim denied by the junta that seized power in 2020.
nya: Cha pompano, mayiko a kwa azungu  atsutsa kufika kwa asilikali ochokera ku Russia kufika ku likulu la dziko la Mali, Bamako, zoneneza zomwe zinakanidwa ndi a Junta omwe anasiya ulamuliro mu 2020

eng: As relations with France worsen, the military rulers may be looking for ways to make up for shrinking numbers of European troops fighting Mali's years-old jihadist insurgency.
nya: Pamene ma ubale ndi dziko la France akuonongekerabe, olamulira usilikali atha kumayang'ana njira yokonzera pa kuchepa kwa magulu a khondo omwe akumenya nkhondo a Jihadi omwe atha chaka a ku Mali

eng: Mercs [mercenaries] working in Africa is an established norm thanks in part to decades of operations by contractors from South Africa, said Jason Blazakis of the New York-based Soufan Group think tank.
nya: Asilikali obwerawa kudzagwira ntchito ku Africa ndi chikhalidwe chokhazikika kuyamikira mbali inakwa zaka makumi ntchito yogwiridwa ndi anthu a ku South Africa,Jason Blakazis wochokera soufan group ya ku Newyork think tank anatero

eng: The Wagner folks are walking through a door that has long been open to their ilk, he added.
No information is publicly available about the group's size or finances.
nya: Palibe  Nkhani iliyonse yomwe ikupezeka poyera yokhudza kukura kwa gulu kapena zachuma.

eng: But around Africa, the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) in Washington has found evidence since 2016 of Russian soldiers of fortune in Sudan, South Sudan, Libya, the Central African Republic (CAR), Madagascar and Mozambique.
nya: Koma kuzungulira mu Africa, a Centre for Strategic and International Stadies (SCIS) ku Washington  apeza umboni kuchokera 2016 wa msilikari waku Rassia wa Fortune ku Sudan, ku mmwera kwa Sudan, ku Libya,ku Central Africa Repblic (CAR), Madagascar komanso Mozambique

eng: Botswana, Burundi, Chad, the Comoros, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Congo-Brazzaville, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Nigeria and Zimbabwe are also on the CSIS's list.
nya: Botswana, Burundi, Chad, a Comoros, a Democratic Republic of Congo, Congo-Brazzaville, Guinea, Guinea- Bissau, Nigeria and Zimbabwe nawo ali mu ndandanda wa CSIS's.

eng: In Africa "there is a convergence of many states' interests, including China's," Alexey Mukhin of the Moscow-based Centre for Political Information told AFP.
nya: Mu Africa  " muli chidwi cha kugwirizana kwa maboma ochuluka, kupahatikizapo China," Alexey Mukhin wa Moscow-based Centre for Political Information wauza AFP.

eng: Every state has the right to defend its business assets, he added.
nya: Boma lililonse lili ndi ufulu oteteza katundu wawo wa malonda, " anaonjezera motero.

eng: 'Hysteria'
nya: Chipwirikiti

eng: Wagner does not officially exist, with no company registration, tax returns or organizational chart to be found.
nya: Woyendetsa weni weni kulibe, opanda kulembetsa  kampani, kubweza misokho kapena tchati cha bungwe chipezeke.

eng: When the EU wanted to sanction the group in 2020, it targeted Russian oligarch Yevgeny Prigozhin, an ally of President Vladimir Putin who is suspected of running Wagner.
nya: Pamene a EU amkafuna kulanga gulu mu 2020amkafuna Russian oligarch Yevgeny Prigozhin,  mtsogoleri olimba mtima  Vladimir Putin yemwe amakaikilidwa kuti ndiye akuyendetsa wagner.

eng: It imposed further sanctions in December last year when mercenaries' arrival in Mali appeared certain — drawing accusations of "hysteria" from Moscow.
nya: Maganizo achilango anapitilira kukambidwa mu December chaka chatha pamene  Mercenaries anafika ku Mali pokaonekera kuzomwezo.- kukachotsa mtsotso wa chipwirikiti cha ku Comoros

eng: Western experts say military contractors are embedded in Russia's official forces like intelligence agencies and the army, providing plausible deniability for Moscow.
nya: Akatsiwri a ku mayiko a azungu anena kuti ogwira ntchito a chi silikaliwa ali gawo limodzi la ogwirira ntchito dziko la Russia monga akauniuni wa nzeru komanso gulu la nkhondo omwe akupeleka kukana kwa Moscow

eng: Their deployment to African countries aims to "enable Russia to... regain this sphere of influence" that fell away with the collapse of the Soviet Union, said CSIS researcher Catrina Doxsee.
nya: Kutumizidwa kwawo ku mayiko a ku Africa ndi njira yothandizira Russia kupezanso malo amphamvu kuti izilamulira o,we anayitayika ndikugwa kwa mgwirizano wa Soviet, anatero wakafukufuku wa CSIS Catrina Doxsee

eng: The mercenaries' presence has been growing even faster since a 2019 Russia-Africa summit.
nya: Kupezeka kwa Mercenaries kwakula  koposaposa kwambiri kuyambira mu 2019 mu mkumano wa Russia-Africa.

eng: Moscow has been active "especially in what has traditionally been France's zone of influence" in former colonies like CAR and Mali, said Djallil Lounnas, a researcher at Morocco's Al Akhawayn university.
nya: Dziko laMoscow lakhala lochitachita makamakamu malo omwe akhala odziwika kuti ndi dera lomwe dziko la France imatakataka ku mayiko omwe anatengedwa mbuyomu monga CAR, ndi Mali, anatero Djallil Lounnas, wochita kafukufuku ku sukulu ya ukachenjede ya ku Morroco yotchedwa  Al Akhawayn university.

eng: While military contractors sometimes shepherd Russian arms sales, the revenue "really pales compared with the profit they are able to generate from mining concessions and access to natural resources," Doxsee said.
nya: Pamene ogwira ntchito a chisilikali nthawi zina amasamala zogulitsa za nkhondo za Russia, chuma cholowa "kuchepa kwambili kutengera ndi  phindu lomwe amapezapo kuchokera ku miala ya mtengo yapatali yomwe amakumba komanso zachilengedwe," anatero Doxsee

eng: That makes unstable countries with mineral or hydrocarbon wealth prime customers — such as in Syria where the mercenaries first became known to the wider public.
nya: Izi zimapangitsa maiko osakhazikika ndi miyala ya mtengo wa patali kapena ogula akuluakulu adzala ndi hdrocarbon monga ku Syria komwe asilikali a kunja odzagwira ganyu anayamba kudziwika kwa anthu ambili

eng: No questions asked
nya: Palibe funso linafunsidwa

eng: Lounnas said that another advantage for clients is a lack of friction over human rights and democracy that might come with Western partners.
nya: Lounnas anati ubwino wina wa ogula ndi kusowekera kwa kusemphana pa ma ufulu a anthu ndi ufulu wa ndale wa democracy womwe utha kubwera ndi opanga nawo mgwilizano wa malonda ochokera ku maiko a ku madzulo kwa azungu.

eng: Russia has its interests. It doesn't ask questions, he added.
nya: Dziko la Russia lili ndi zomwe ikufunapo. Ilo silimafunsa mafunsa mafunso, anaphatikizirapo

eng: Reports of violence and abuse on the ground suggest that same latitude may extend to the mercenaries themselves.
nya: Mauthenga okhudzana nd ziwawa komanso kuzunza omwe akuchitika akusonyeza kutu zomwezi zitha kuchitikanso ndi asilikali a ganyu omwewanso

eng: In the CAR, the United Nations is probing an alleged massacre during a joint operation by government forces and Wagner fighters.
nya: Ku dziko la CAR,bungwe la gwilizano wa mayiko la United Nations likufufuzabe kuphedwa mawa chiwembu kwa anthu ambili komwe kunachitika nthawi yomwe asilikali a boma komanso a Wagner amagwilira ntchito limodzi.

eng: One military source told AFP that more than 50 people died, some in "summary executions."
nya: mmodzi wa gulu la nkhondo anauza AFP kuti anthu opitilira 50 anafa ena mochita kunyongedwa osaweruzidwa

eng: On Thursday, the European Union said it would not resume military training in the CAR — suspended since mid-December — unless the country's soldiers stop working for Wagner.
nya: Lachinayi, bungwe la European Union linanena kuti siliamba kuphunzitsa asilikali ku CAR zomwe zinayimitsidwa pakati pa mwezi wa December mpaka pokhapokha asilikali a dzikolo atasiya kugwilira ntchito dziko la Wagner

eng: Meanwhile the mercenaries' results do not always measure up to the hopes of the governments that hire them.
nya: Pakanali pano, zotsatira za asilikali a ganyuwa sizimafikira chiyembekezo cha boma lomwe linawalemba ganyulo.

eng: In Libya, Russian mercenaries suffered heavy losses in Marshal Khalifa Haftar's year-long attempt to conquer the capital Tripoli, which was ultimately unsuccessful.
nya: Ku dziko la Libya, asilikali ochokera Russia analephera kwambili mu  yoyesetsa kugonjetsa likulu la Tripoli pa ntchito ya chaka chonse ya Marshal Khalifa Haftar, yomwe kwakukulu siyinapambane.

eng: And in Mozambique, the Russians retreated in the face of Islamic State group jihadists, ultimately losing out to South African competitors.
nya: Ndipo ku Mocambique, asilikali aku Russia anathawa mmaso mwa gulu la dziko la chisilamu la Jihadi, komwe ndi kulephera kwakukulu ndi olimbana nawo a kumwera kwa Africa

eng: Although lacking language skills and experience with the terrain, Wagner "were picked because they were the cheapest", Doxsee said.
nya: Ngakhale pali kupeleweledwa pa lusola chiyankhulo komanso ukadaulo pa ntchito ndi terrain, dziko la Wagner "anasankhidwa chifukwa anali osafuna ndalama zambili pa onse'" anatero Doxsee

eng: They didn't have what it took to succeed, she added, noting that "they've had a fair few failures" across Africa.
nya: Analibe zowayenereza kuti apambane, iye anaphatikizamotero, pozindikira kuti " anakhalapo ndi kulehera kangapo konse" mayiko osiyanasiyana mu Africa

eng: Succeeding completely might actually harm the mercenaries' business model, which thrives on unrest, conflict and crisis.
nya: Kupambana kwathunthu kutha kusokoneza ntchito ya asilikili a ganyuwa, yomwe kupita patsogolo kwake kumadalira zisokonezo, mikangano komanso mavuto.

eng: If a country such as the CAR hires them to train forces, to help them in their military efforts, its in their interest to accomplish that just well enough to continue to be employed, Doxsee said.
nya: Ngati dziko monga CAR litawalemba iwo ntchito yophunzitsa a silikali ena kuti awathandizire kumenya nkhondo, ndizofunikira kwa iwo kuti agwire ntchitoyo ndi kuimaliza bwino ngati akufuna kuti apitilize kupatsidwabe ncthito, anatero Doxsee

eng: If they actually were to do it well enough to resolve the conflict, they would no longer be needed.
nya: Ngati atagwira ntchito bwino kwambili ndikuthetsa kusamvetsetsana, pamenepo sangafunikirenso.

eng: Cyclone Batsirai Weakens After Hitting Madagascar, Floods Feared
nya: Mphepo yapanyanja ya Batsirai inchepamphamvu itaombaku Madagascar, madzi osefukira anaopedwa.

eng: Cyclone Batsirai weakened overnight but floods were still expected due to heavy rain after it hit eastern Madagascar with strong winds, the island's meteorological office said Sunday.
nya: Mphepo yapanyanja  inachepa mphamvu mukanthawi kochepa koma madzi osefukira amayembekezerekabe chifukwa cha mvura yochuluka  ndi mphepo yamphamvu yomwe imaomba ku mmawa kwa Madagascar, Ofesi ya pachilumba cha Meteorological inanena izi Lamulungu.

eng: Batsirai has weakened, Meteo Madagascar said, adding that the cyclone's average wind speed had almost halved to 80 kph, while the strongest gusts had scaled back to 110 kph from the 235 kph recorded when it made landfall on Saturday evening.
nya: Batsarai wachepa mphamvu, anatero  Meteo Madagascar, anaonjezera kuti kathamangidwe ka mphepo yapanyanjayi  katsika pafupifupi ndi theka  kufika pa 80khp, pamene mphepo yamphamvuyi yatsika kufika pa 110khp kuchoka pa 235 khp zomwe zinalembedwa loweluka madzulo.

eng: The cyclone, the second storm to hit the large Indian Ocean island nation in just a few weeks, was moving westwards at a rate of 19 kph, the meteorological services said.
nya: Mphepo yapanyanja, Namondwe wachiwiri aomba kwambiri pa chilumba  cha nyanja yaikulu ya india mmasabata ochepa akubwerawa. Amayenda kulunjika kummawa pa mulingo wa 19khp, oona zanyengo zapanyanja anatero.

eng: But "localized or generalized floods are still feared following the heavy rains," it said, adding that Batsirai should emerge at sea in the Mozambique Channel later Sunday.
nya: koma pakuona kochepa komanso kwakukulu madzi osefukira akuopsabe chifukwa cha mvura yochuluka, anatero, kuonjezera apo Batarai kuoneka  panyanja  pamakina a mozambique Lamulungu madzulo

eng: Batsirai made landfall in Mananjary district, more than 530 kilometers southeast of the capital Antananarivo, around 8 p.m. local time (1700 GMT) Saturday.
nya: Batsarai anapangitsa kuonongeka kwa malo ku Mananjary district, mtunda wautali kuposera 530 kummwera kwa mzinda waukulu wa Antananarivo, chamma 8 koloko madzulo nthwi yakwawoko(1700GMT) Loweluka.

eng: It reached the island as an "intense tropical cyclone", packing winds of 165 kph, Faly Aritiana Fabien of the country's disaster management agency told AFP.
nya: iInafika pachilumbapo ngati mphepo yaikulu yoononga yapa nyanja,"ndimulungo wa mphepo  wa 165 khp,  Flay Aritiana Fabien oyang'anira za ngozi za dzidzi mudziko anauza AFP.

eng: The national meteorological office has said it fears "significant and widespread damage."
nya: mMalo ogwilira ntchito oyanga'ana za nyengo zapanyanja ati akuopa" mulingo komanso kufarikira kwkukulukwa kuonongeka.

eng: Just an hour and a half after it first hit land, nearly 27,000 people had been counted as displaced from their homes, Fabien said.
nya: Patangodutsa ola limodzi chitsikireni, pafupifupi anthu 27,000 anawerengedwa kuti achotsedwa mmakomo mwawo, anatero Fabien

eng: He said his office has accommodation sites, food and medical care ready for victims, as well as search and rescue plans already in place.
nya: Anati malo awo ogwilira ntchito ali ndimalo osungiramo anthu. Chakudya komanso thandizo lachipatara zilipo kale kuti atha kuthandiza okhudzika, komanso kuyang'ana nd idongosolo lo pulumotsa zonse zili mmalo mwake.

eng: 'Very serious threat'
nya: Chiopsezo chachikulu kwambiri

eng: The Meteo-France weather service had earlier predicted Batsirai would present "a very serious threat" to Madagascar, after passing Mauritius and drenching the French island of La Reunion with torrential rain for two days.
nya: Iwo oona za nyengo zapanyanja  a france weather analosera kuti Batsarai atha kubwera " chiopsezo chachikulu ku Madagascar. Atatha kudutsa ku Mauritius ndikudutsanso ku chilumba cha French cha La Reunion ndi mvura yamphamvu kwa masiku awiri.

eng: In the hours before the cyclone hit, residents hunkered down in the impoverished country, still recovering from the deadly Tropical Storm Ana late last month.
nya: Mmaora mphepo yapanyanja isanaombe, anthu okhalako anathamangira ku dziko lovutikali, likuchila kuzowawa zakudza ndi Namondwe otchedwa Ana kumapeto kwa mwezi wathawu

eng: In the eastern coastal town of Vatomandry, more than 200 people were crammed in one room in a Chinese-owned concrete building.
nya: Ku dera lakummawa kwa mzinda wa Vatomandry, anthu opitilira 200 anathinikizidwa mu chipinda chimodzi mu nyumba ya mzika ya China

eng: Families slept on mats or mattresses.
nya: mawanja amagona pa mphasa kapena pa matilesi.

eng: Community leader Thierry Louison Leaby lamented the lack of clean water after the water utility company turned off supplies ahead of the cyclone.
nya: Otsogolera anthu Thierry Louison Leaby anadandula za kusowa kwa madzi aukhondo pamene bungwe loyan'ganira madzi anawatsekera madzi pambuyo pa namondwe

eng: People are cooking with dirty water, he said, amid fears of a diarrhea outbreak.
nya: Anthu akupikira madzi oipa,  anatero, alindimantha ndi  mulili otsekura mmimba.

eng: Outside plastic dishes and buckets were placed in a line to catch rainwater dripping from the corrugated roofing sheets.
nya: Ziwiya zakunja ndi mabigili anaikidwa pamzere kutunga madzi amvura omwe amagwera kuchokera padenga lanyumba zamalata'

eng: The government must absolutely help us. We have not been given anything, he said.
nya: Boma likungoyenera kutithandiza ,takhala tisakupatsidwa chilichonse, " anatero.

eng: Residents who chose to remain in their homes used sandbags and yellow jerrycans to buttress their roofs.
nya: Anthu omwe anasankha kukharabe mmanyumba mwawo amagwiritsa ntchito matumba amchinga ndizigubu za chikaso kufolera denga lawo.

eng: Cyclone still 'dangerous'
nya: Mphepo yapanyanja ikanali yoopsa

eng: Other residents of Vatomandry were stockpiling supplies in preparation for the storm.
nya: Othu ena okhara  ku Vatomandry anapatsidwa zakudya, katundu pakukonzekera mphepo.

eng: We have been stocking up for a week, rice but also grains because with the electricity cuts we cannot keep meat or fish, said Odette Nirina, a 65-year-old hotelier in Vatomandry.
nya: Tapatsidwa  katundu okwanira sabata,mpunga komanso chimanga chifukwa ndikuduka kwa magetse sitingathe kusunga  nyama komanso nsomba, " Odette Nirina anatero,  wa zaka 65 waku  malo gonera alendo ku Vatomandry.

eng: I have also stocked up on coal. Here we are used to cyclones, she told AFP.
nya: Ndapatsidwanso zogwilitsira ntchito kuinika ndi moto.Kuno tinazolowera mphepo zapanyanja, anauza AFP.

eng: Winds of more than 50 kph pummeled Vatomandry on Saturday morning, accompanied by intermittent rain.
nya: Mphepo yoposera 50 khp inaomba ku  vatomandr mmawa wa loweluka,  pamodzi ndi mvura yankhuntho.

eng: The disaster agency said the cyclone was expected to remain "dangerous" as it swept across the large island overnight and in the morning.
nya: Owona za ngozi za dzidzi ati  mphepo yapanyanjayi imayembekezereka kupitilirabe "zoopsa" pamene iku ukuomba  pachilumba chachikulu usiku onse komanso mammawa.

eng: Flooding is expected due to excessive rainfall in the east, southeast and central regions of the country, it warned.
nya: kukuyembekezeleka kusefukira kwa madzi chifukwa cha mvura yochuluka yomwe yagwa mzigawo za dziko, ku mmawa, kummwera komanso pakati, yachenjeza.

eng: The United Nations was ramping up its preparedness with aid agencies, placing rescue aircraft on standby and stockpiling humanitarian supplies.
nya: Abungwe la United Nations  akupanga njira zokonzekera ndi thandizo, kuika  ndikuomzekeretsa ndege zopulumutsa anthu komanso kupeleka katundu othandizira athu.

eng: At least 131,000 people were affected by Ana across Madagascar in late January. Close to 60 people were killed, mostly in the capital Antananarivo.
nya: Anthu pafupifupi 131,000 anakhudzika nd mphepo yapanyanja ya Ana yomwe inaopmba ku Madagascar kumamaliziro a January. Anthu pafupifupi 60 anaphedwa, kwambiri mumzinda waukulu wa Antananarivo.

eng: That storm also hit Malawi, Mozambique and Zimbabwe, causing dozens of deaths.
nya: Namondwe ameneyu anaombanso ku Malawi, Mozambique komanso Zimbabwe, anadzetsa imfa zochuluka.

eng: The U.N.'s World Food Program pointed to estimates from national authorities that some 595,000 people could be directly affected by Batsirai, and 150,000 more might be displaced due to new landslides and flooding.
nya: Bungwe la U.N's World food Program linasakhidwa kuti lionetsetse kuchokera kwa mautsogoleri a mmaiko kuti anthu ena 595,000 athakukhara anakhudzidwa ndi Batsarai, ndipo  oposera 150,000 atha kukhala kuti anasunthidwa  chifukwa cha zivomelezi zatsopano komanso kusefukira kwa madzi.

eng: The storm poses a risk to at least 4.4 million people in one way or another, the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies said.
nya: Mphepoyi inabweletsa chiopsezo kwa anthu pafupifupi 4.4 miliyoni munjira zosiyana siyana, anatero a bungwe la International Federation of Red Cross ndi bungwe la Red Crescent Societies .

eng: US Catholic Clergy Shortage Eased by Recruits From Africa
nya: Bungwe la US Catholic Clergy Shortage Eased by Recruits From Africa

eng: The Rev. Athanasius Chidi Abanulo — using skills honed in his African homeland to minister effectively in rural Alabama— determines just how long he can stretch out his Sunday homilies based on who is sitting in the pews.
nya: Abusa a Rev. Athanasius Chidi Abanulo- Anagwiritsa nchito luso lawo lokhazikika mudzika lawo ku Africa kutumikira mwa machawi ku mudzi ya Alabama-Zikutengera kuti kodi ndinthawi yatali bwanji yomwe angafikire mabanja okhazikika omwe amabwera kuzapephera mu kachisi mwake Lamulung.

eng: Seven minutes is the sweet spot for the mostly white and retired parishioners who attend the English-language Mass at Immaculate Conception Catholic Church in the small town of Wedowee. "If you go beyond that, you lose the attention of the people," he said.
nya: Mpindi zisanu ndi ziwiri ndipamalo pokoma makamaka kwa azungu komanso kwa iwo akhristu opuma omwe amapita ku mkumano wa mapemphero achiyankhuro cha chizungu ku Immaculate Conception Catholic Church mu mzinda waung'ono wa Wedowee." ukapitilira pamenepo, umasiya kumvetsera za anthu, anatero.

eng: For the Spanish-language Mass an hour later, the Nigerian-born priest — one of numerous African clergy serving in the U.S. — knows he can quadruple his teaching time. "The more you preach, the better for them," he said.
nya: mMapephero amuchiyankhuro cha spanish pakatha ora limodzi, Wansembe wachi Nigeria mmodzi mwa otuikira ochuruka aku Afrika ku US- amadziwa kuti atha kutalikitsa nthawi yake yakuphinzitsa ndi kanayi. " mochuluka momwe ukulalikira, zabwino kwa iwo," anatero.

eng: As he moves from one American post to the next, Abanulo has learned how to tailor his ministry to the culture of the communities he is serving while infusing some of the spirit of his homeland into the universal rhythms of the Mass.
nya: Pamene amachoka pa udindo waku america kupita pena, Abanulo anaphunzira kumanga utumiki wake mogwirizana ndichikalidwe chamudera lomwe akutumikira pamene akuthandiziranso mzimu wa dziko lake mapemphero achipulumutso.

eng: Nigerian people are relaxed when they come to church, Abanulo said. "They love to sing, they love to dance. The liturgy can last for two hours. They don't worry about that."
nya: Anthu aku Nigeria sakhala ndichidwi akabwera ku tchalitchi, Aanatero Abunulo. "Amakonda kuimba, amakonda kuvina. Mapemphero atha kutha maora awiri. Iwo sadandaura za zimenezo."

eng: During his 18 years in the U.S., Abanulo has filled various chaplain and pastor roles across the country, epitomizing an ongoing trend in the American Catholic church. As fewer American-born men and women enter seminaries and convents, U.S. dioceses and Catholic institutions have turned to international recruitment to fill their vacancies.
nya: Pamene anali ndi zaka 18 ku U.S , Abunulo wakalapo pamaudindo oyang'anira zamapemphero komanso kugwira nchito za Ubusa mdziko monse. Ntchito zabwino zakhara  zikupititlira kumveka  ku  matchalichi a chikatolika ku America. Mbadwadwa zobadwira ku amerika komko amuna komanso akazi analowa ku umsembe ndi usisitreri. Zigawo za U.S komanso mabugwe a katolika anasitha kukhala olemba athu dziko lonse polemba anthu omwe amafuna.

eng: The Diocese of Birmingham, where Abanulo leads two parishes, has widened its search for clergy to places with burgeoning religious vocations like Nigeria and Cameroon, said Birmingham Bishop Steven Raica. Priests from Africa were also vital in the Michigan diocese where Raica previously served.
nya: Zigawo za Birminham, komwe Abunulo amatsogolera mipingo iwiri, Wakulitsa kayang'ana malo okhazikitsa mpingo ndikuchulukitsa malo ogwilira ntchito achipepembedzo ngati Nigeria ndi Cameroon, anatero Abishop Steven Raica aku Birminham. Wamsembe ochokera ku Africa komanso wamphamvu ku chigawo cha Michigan komwe Raica amatumikira MMbuyomu

eng: They have been an enormous help to us to be able to provide the breadth and scope of ministry that we have available to us, he said.
nya: Akhala akutithandiza kwambiri kuti tikwanitse kulinga mulingo komanso ukulu wa unduna omwe tili nawo kwa ife, anatero

eng: Africa is the Catholic church's fastest-growing region. There, the seminaries are "fairly full," said the Rev. Thomas Gaunt, director of Georgetown University's Center for Applied Research in the Apostolate, which conducts research about the Catholic church.
nya: Ku Africa ndi chigawo chimene tchaitchi cha chi katolika  chakula mwachangu kwambiri. Kumene malo aansembe ndiodzadza, anatero Rev Thomas Gaunnt, Wankulu otsogolera  Sukulu yaukachenjede ya Centre for Applied  Research in the Apostolate,  imene imapanga kafukufuku wa mpingo wa katolika.

eng: Falling numbers
nya: Kutsika kwa ma nambala.

eng: It's different in the U.S. where the Catholic church faces significant hurdles in recruiting home-grown clergy following decades of declining church attendance and the damaging effects of widespread clergy sex abuse scandals.
nya: Ndizosiyana ndiku U.S kumene mpingo  wa katolika wakumana ndimavuto pakulemba anthu omwe akulira mu mpingo mommo kutsalira  kutsika kwa kabweledwe ka anthu ku mpingo kwa zaka teni zapitazi komanso kuonongeka kwa mbiri yomwe inafala ya nchititdwe ogonana wa pa mpingo.

eng: Catholic women and married men remain barred from the priesthood; arguments that lifting those bans would ease the priest shortage have not gained traction with the faith's top leadership.
nya: Azimayi achikatolika komanso azibambo okwatira ndiokanizidwabe ku umsembe; Mtsutso ochotsa chiletsochi ukanathetsa vuto lakusowa kwa amsembe omwe sanapeze chikoka ndi chikhulupiliro kwa atsogoleri akulu akulu.

eng: What we have is a much smaller number beginning in the 1970s entering seminaries or to convents across the country, Gaunt said. "Those who entered back in the '50s and '60s are now elderly, and so the numbers are determined much more by mortality."
nya: Zomwe tilinazo pano ndi nambala yochipa kwambiri  kuyambira 1970 kulowa umsembe komanso usisiteri mudziko, Gaunt anatero. Iwo amene analowa mu zaka za mma 50 komanso 60 panopa ndi ndiokalamba, ndipo ma numbara akutengera  kambiri ndianthu omwe akumwalira.
