eng: High-level African officials met virtually this week to discuss the challenges Africa faces in trying to manage a growing population amid climate change. The conference was aimed at identifying ways African governments can manage these pressures to minimize or avoid conflict.
nya: Akulu akulu  amulingu wapamwamba a m'boma anakumana  mowilikiza sabata ino  pokambirana mavuto omwe Africa akukumana nawo  pofuna kukomza kukura kwa chiwelengero cha anthu pamabali yakusintha kwa nyengo. Mkumanawu cholinga chake kunali  kupeza njira zomwe maboma amu Africa  angatahnirane ndimavuto amenewa pochepetsa kapena kupewa mkangano..

eng: Africa generates about 3% percent of global greenhouse gas emissions, the lowest of any continent. But its more vulnerable than any other region in the world, since Africans depend so heavily on their natural environment for food, water and medicine.
nya: Africa imapanga pafupifupi 3% ya malo omwe amachotsa mpweya oipa mulengalenga, ali pansi pa makomtineti onse, koma ndizosafunikira kwambiri kusiyana ndi zigawo zonse zapa dzikolapansi, pakuti Africa imadalira kwambiri pa zachilengedwa chawo pa zakudya, madzi komanso mankhwala.

eng: Speaking at a virtual conference Tuesday on climate, conflict and demographics in Africa, Nigerian Vice President Yemi Osinbajo said African governments need to keep the climate in mind as they try to boost their economies.
nya: Kuyankhula pa mkumano wa pakanema Lchiwiri pa zanyengo,  mikangano ndi chiwelengero cha anthu mu Africa,  wachiwiri wa mtsogoliri wa dziku la Nigeria Yemi Osibanjo anati amaboma amu Africa akuyenera kumaganizira za nyengo pamene akuyesera kukweza chuma chawo.

eng: Our first obligation for us and for African countries must always be to ensure the well-being of our people through access to development services, including electricity, health care, education, safe jobs and a safe environment, including access to clean cooking fuels. We must prioritize solutions that align the development and climate agenda, and that is absolutely important, said Osinbajo.
nya: Undindo wathu oyambilira  wa ife ndi maiko amu Africa  ukuyenera nthawi zonse kukhara  owonetsetsa  chisamaliro cha anthu anthu kudzera pakupeza zithandizo zapamwamba, kuphatikizilapo magetsi, thandizo la zaumoyo, maphunziro, ncthito zotetezeka komanso  malo achitetezo kupatikiza mafuta ophikira abwino, Tikuyenera titsogoze  myankho omwe ali ogwilizana ndi chitukuko komanso ali ndi cholinga cha zanyengo, ndipo ichi ndichofunikira kwambiri, anatero Osinbajo.

eng: The Center for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters, based in Brussels, says that in 2019, Africa recorded 56 extreme weather events compared to 45 in the previous year.
nya: Bungwe la Center for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters, lomwe lili ku Brussels, linanena izi mu 2019, Africa yapezeka ndikuvuta kwakukulu kwa nyengo  ndi mulingo wa 56 kusiyana ndi  45 pa mulingo wa zaka za mmbuyo .

eng: The extreme weather patterns affected the lives of 16.6 million people in 29 countries. At least 13 million of them were from five countries: Kenya, Mozambique, Somalia, Tanzania and Zimbabwe.
nya: kuchita kwa nyengo yovutayi kwa khudza miyoyo ya anthu 16.6 miliyoni mmaiko 29. pafupifupi 13 milliyon mwa iwo anali ochokera ku maiko asanu: Kenya, Mozambique, Somalia, Tanzania ndi Zimbabwe.

eng: West Africa had fewer weather-related catastrophes but is feeling the effects of global warming just the same.
nya: chigawo chakumadzulo cha Africa chili ndi nyengo zoononga zochepa komabe  vuto lakuonongeka kwa mpweya wamulengalenga kukumawakhudza chimodzi modzi.

eng: Ghana environment minister Kwaku Afriyie explains how climate change has impacted agricultural lands in the country.
nya: Nduna yoona za nyengo ku Ghana Kwaku Afriyie anafotokoza momwe kusintha kwa nyengo kwa khudzira malo aulimi mdzikomo.

eng: The harsh and deteriorating climate conditions in northern Ghana undoubtedly energized region-growing food insecurity and seasonal north-to-south migration. And besides, increasing of floods and protracted drought lead to displacement of people. Statistics show that over the last few years, there has been a new internal displacement which has occurred in Ghana due to climate-induced disasters and even beyond our borders, he said.
nya:
Kuvuta ndikupitilira kwa kuvuta kwa nyengo yoononga ku mpoto kwa Ghana mosakaikitsa zionjezera kukula kwa kusowa chakudya ndipo zipangitsa anthu kuchoa ku mpoto kupita ku mwera. Ndipo kupatura izikuchuluka kwa madzi osefukula ndikukhalitsa kwa chilara kupangitsa anthu kusamuka. Kalembera wa anthu anaonetsa izi zaka zochepa zapitazo,pakhala kusamuka kwa mkati komwe kawchitika ku Ghana chifukwa chakuchitika kwa ngozi zadzidzi  ngakhalenso kudutsa  zipata zathu, Iye anatero.
The U.N. special representative to the African Union, Hannah Tetteh, said the continent needs to improve cross-border information-sharing and cooperation to handle climate-related crises. 	Katswiri oimilira  maiko amu  United Nations (U.N) ku maiko amu mgwiriano wa mu Africa ( African Union) Hannah Tetteh,  anati kontineti ikufunika kupititsa patsogolo njira zofalitsira nkhani kunja ndi mgwirizano okonza  zokhudzana ndikuvuta kwa nyengo.
The challenge has not been that we havent developed yet these structures. The challenge has been we have not utilized them yet effectively, and that goes to issues of national sovereignty and the unwillingness of member states to have others, as it were, take an active interest and maybe recommend the things that need to be done in order to respond to a particular crisis. And if we recognize we are all in this together, then that certainly has to change," she said.
column3: Sikuti vuto lakhala kuti sitinamange zinthu zimenezi. Vuto lakhala kuti sitinazigwilitsebe ntchito bwino, izizi zikulozabenkhani ya umodzi mdziko komanso kusowekera kwa kufuna kwa anthu a mu dziko kukhala nawo ena monga zinalili kukhala nacho chidwi chochitachita komanso mwina kulangiza zinthu zomwe tingachite kuti tigonjetse vuto lina lake. Ndipo ngati tingazindikire tili limodzimu izi, kenako zinthuzi zikuyenera kusintha, iye anatero.

eng: As for specific suggestions, Osinbajo suggested governments encourage greater use of natural gas and plant more trees to maintain forests that can soak up carbon dioxide and prevent it from warming the atmosphere.
nya: Pa maganizo apaderadera, Osinbajo anapeleka maganizo akuti boma limalimbikitsa kugwiritsa ntchito mpweya wa chilengedwe komanso kubzyala mitengo ndicholinga chosunga nkhalango zomwe zimayamwa mpweya oyipa wa carbondioxide komanso kupewetsa kuetentha kwa dziko lonse komwe kumadza ndi kuonongeka kwa bulangete ya mlengalenga.

eng: Young Africans Struggle With Jobs, Education Amid Pandemic
nya: Achinyamata aku Afrika avutika ndi ntchito, mapahunziro mkatikati mwa mlili

eng: The future looked promising for Tinashe Mapuranga, an intern at a leading bank in Zimbabwe who appeared set to get a staff position as soon as he completed his college degree. Then the COVID-19 pandemic hit.
nya: Tsogolo limkaoneka lowala pa Tinashe Mapuranga, ophunzira ntchito pa nkhokwe ya ndalama (bank) yotsogola ku Zimbabwe yemwe anaoneka kuti adzapeza mwayi olembedwa ntchito pompo akamaliza maphunziro ake a ukachenjede. Patatha izi mlili wa COVID 19 unakantha.

eng: Amid the lockdowns, the 24-year-old was one of the first to be laid off and has no idea when he'll be able to get his degree because of frequent school closures.
nya: Mkatikati mwa kutseka zipata zolowera mmayiko, wachinyamata wa zaka 24 yu anali mmodzi mwa omwe anachotsedwa ndipo alibe chiyembekezo pa nthawi ya kumaliza maphunziro ake chifukwa cha kutsekatseka kwa masukulu

eng: It has really affected me a lot in my studies. I have no money to buy data and I don't have a personal laptop to study online and keep up like what others are doing, said Mapuranga, who lives with his mother in Chitungwiza, a sprawling working-class area southeast of Harare, the capital.
nya: Izi zandisokoneza kwambili paphunziro anga ndithu. Ndilibe ndalama zogulira mayunitsi a pa intaneti(data) komanso ndilibe laptop yangayanga kuti ndikwanitse kuphunzira nawo pa intaneti ndikupitiliza kuphunzira monga azanga akuchitira., anatero Mapuranga, amene amakhala ndi mai ake ku Chitungwiza, dera lomwe lili ndi anthu ambili odalira maganyu kummawa kwa ku mwera kwa Harare, likulu la dzikoli.

eng: I was supposed to finish in November or December 2021, but as of now, we haven't completed much of the work, he said. "Truly speaking, I am not sure when I will finish the degree. I can't wait to graduate and find a job and do something tangible in life."
nya: Ndimayenera kumaliza mu Novembara chaka cha 2021 koma pakanali pano, sitinaphunzire zambili, Iye anatero. " Kunena zoona, sindikudziwa kuti ndimaliza liti maphunziroanga a sukulu ya ukachenjede. Ndikufunitsitsa nditamaliza komanso ndikupeza ntchito , kenako ndikuchita zinthu zooneka mmoyo."

eng: Mapuranga spends most of his time at home, tending a tiny vegetable garden that is the family's main source of food. His mother ekes out a living traveling to South Africa to sell things like stone carvings and brooms on the streets, a trade also badly hit by the pandemic.
nya: Nthawi yambili ya Mapuranga amakhala ku nyumba, kusamalira kadimba ka masamba komwe banja lakwawo limapezerapo chakudya. Mayi ake amazithandizira mmoyo wawo popita ku dziko la South AFRICA kukagulitsa ziboliboli. Ndi masache mmiseu, amodzi a malonda omwe akhudzidwa kwambili ndi mliliwu.

eng: We've been trying to hustle to get some money, he said. "I tried to do a small business selling cooking gas but the authorities chased us away from the streets. My father passed away. My mother is into informal business, but it's also down with these lockdowns. Things are not well right now. It's tough."
nya: Takhala tikuyesetsa kugwira ntchito molimbika kuti tipeze ndalama, iye anatero. Ndinayesera kupanga malonda aang'ono ogulitsa nkhuni mu misewu koma adindo anatithamangitsamo. Bambo anga anamwalira. Mayi anga machita malonda osakhazikika omwe nawo ayima kamba kakutseka zipata za mayiko. Zinthu sizili bwino pakali pano. zathina."

eng: Mapuranga's situation might look dire, but he says he's concerned about some of his unemployed peers who have fallen into alcohol, drugs and prostitution.
nya: Nyengo ya Mapuranga itha kumaoneka yakakasi, koma iye wati ali nkdi nkhawa chifukwa cha amzake omwe samagwira ntchito omwe atayikira ku mowa, mankhwala ozunguza ubongo komanso uhule.

eng: Many youths have lost hope, he said.
nya: Achinyamata ambili ataya chiyembekezo, iye natero

eng: Across Africa, many others like Mapuranga are battling the economic downturn caused by COVID-19, losing jobs and seeing their education disrupted, a survey of people aged 18-24 in 15 countries has found.
nya: Mu Afrika, ambili ofanana ndi Mapurangaakuvutika mndi kuvuta kwa chuma komwe kwadza chufkwa cha COVID-19, kutha kwa ntchito komanso kuona kusokonezedwa kwa maphunziro awo, kafukufuku waanthu a zaka za pakti pa 18 ndi 24 mu mayiko 15 wapeza zimenezi.

eng: The pandemic increased the already-high level of unemployment among the group, according to preliminary findings of the second annual Africa Youth Survey.
nya: Potengera zotsatira za kafukufuku wachiwiri wa pa chaka wokhudza achinyamata a ku Afrika,mliliwu wakulitsa chiwerengo chomwe chinali chokwera kale cha anthu osagwira ntchito pa gululi.

eng: Nearly 20% of the 4,500 respondents said they became unemployed because of the pandemic and 37% were forced to stop or pause their education. Another 8% saw their pay docked, 18% had to move back home and 10% said they had to care for family members, according to the survey, which was commissioned by the Johannesburg-based Ichikowitz Family Foundation, whose founder, Ivor Ichikowitz, runs Paramount Group, an aerospace, security and military contractor.
nya: Pa anthu 20 aliwonse pa anthu 100 mu athu okwanira 4500 omwe anatenga nawo gawo mu kafukufuku anati iwo anakhala opanda ntchito chifukwa cha mliliwu ndipo anthu 37 pa anthu 100 aliwonse anakakamizidwa kusiya kapena kuima pa maphunziro awo. Pa anthu 8 ena aliwonse pa anthu 100 anatsitsilidwa malipilo. ndipo anthu 18aliwonse pa anthu 100 anabwerera kwawo komanso anthu 10 aliwonse pa 100 anati amayenera kusamalira abale awo kutengera pa zotsatira za kafukufuku yemwe anatumidwa ndi bungwe la ku Johannesburg la Chikowitz Family Foundation lomwe emwe anayambitsa bungweli, Ivor amayendetsa gulu lalikulu lazomangazmanga.

eng: Of the 1.3 billion people in Africa's 54 countries, an estimated 250 million are aged 18-24. The study was conducted in major urban and trading centers in Angola, Congo, the Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Gabon, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi, Mozambique, Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa, Sudan, Uganda and Zambia. The researchers for PSB Insights, a global polling company, were nationals of each country where the survey took place and went door-to-door for in-depth, face-to-face interviews.
nya: Pa anthu 1.3 billion omwe ali mmayiko 54 a ku AFRIKA, pafupifupi anthu 250million ali ndi zaka za pakati pa 18 mdi 24. Kafukufukui anapangidwa ku misika ikulu ikulu ya mmatauni ku Angola, Congo, Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Gabon, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi, Mozambique, Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa, Sudan Uganda, ndi Zambia. Akafukufuku wa PBS insight, kampani ya dziko lonse,omwe anthu a mudziko lililonse komwe kafukufukuyi anachitikira komanso nayenda khomo ndi khomo kuti apeze zakuya komanso kucheza maso ndi maso.

eng: People surveyed said the pandemic caused substantial disruptions to their schooling, emphasizing the need for more computers and internet access in Africa for online education.
nya: Anthu omwe amafufuzidwa anati mliliwu wabweretsa chisokonezo choonekera ku maphunziro awo, potsindika kufunika kwa ma komputa ambili komanso kupezeka kwa intaneti ku Afrika kuti zithandizire maphunziro a pa intaneti.

eng: Bola Badejo, 29, saw her salary at the broadcast station where she worked in Abuja, Nigeria, cut in half, and she complained that she could not make it on the equivalent of $146 a month.
nya: Bola Badejo wa zaka29 nanaona ndalama zake zmwe amalandira pa mwezi ku nuymba youlutsa mawu komwe amagwira ntchito ku Abuja,Nigeria, ikutsitsidwa ndi theka ndipo anadandaura kuti ndalama ofanana mphamvu ndi $146 singakwanilitse zosowa zake.

eng: I was already poor and I was working just for the sake of doing the job, she said. Then, in April 202, she was laid off.
nya: Ndinali wovutika kale ndipo ngati ndimkagwira ntchito mchifukwa chakuti ndisamangokhala,iye antero. Kenako mu mwezi wa April 202, anachotsedwa

eng: I fell into depression because the whole thing was really sad. I felt I had nowhere to go, Badejo said.
nya: Ndagwa mu vuto lophyinjika mu mtima chifukwa zonsezi zinali zokhumudwitsa, anatero Badejo.

eng: After seven months without a job, she started a home cleaning business, and that has boosted her outlook, she said.
nya: Patatha miyezi 7 osagwira ntchito, iye anayamba malonda okonza makomo ndipo ichindi chomwe casinthamoyo wake, iye anatero

eng: Badejo is typical of many who have found different ways to support themselves.
nya: Baadejo ndi ofanana ndi ambili omwe apezanjira zozithandizira okha

eng: In 2020, about 40% of those surveyed expressed optimism about the future. The pandemic dented that confidence, lowering it to 31%, according to the survey.
nya: Kutengera kafukufuku, mu chaka cha 2020, pafupifupi anthu 40 pa anthu 100 aliwonse omwe anayankhapopa kafukufukuyi anaonetsa chiyembekezo chabwino kukhudzana ndi tsogolo. Mliliwu unaononga kulimbika mtima konse , kutsitsa chiwerengerochi kufika anthu 31pa anthu 100 aliwonse.

eng: Uganda has had two lockdowns since April 2020, the second of which was relaxed in July. But businesses involving close human interaction — bars, gyms and nightclubs — remain closed by presidential order, leaving many young people without work.
nya: Kuchokera April 2020, Uganda yakhalapo ndi kutseka zipata za dziko kawiri imene achiwiri yake inakhwefulidwa mu july. Koma malonda omwe amakhudza kuyanjana kwa pafupi kwa anthungati malo omwerako mowa, malo a masewero olimbitsa thupi komanso malo azisangalalo za usiku, apitilira kukhala otsekedwa potsatira lamulo la mtsogoleri wa dziko zomwe zapangitsa achinyamata ambili kukhala opanda ntchito.

eng: Ronald Maathe, a 25-year-old janitor at a gym outside Uganda's capital of Kampala, shook his head sorrowfully when saying that his monthly salary is now the equivalent of $43. That's half of what he used to earn before the pandemic.
nya: Ronald Maathe, wa zaka 25 ogwira ntchitoku gym ya kunja kwa likulu ladziko la Uganda la Kampala, anagwidiza mutu wake mwachisoni ponea kuti ndalama yake yolandira pa mwezi ndi yofanana mphamvu ndi $43. Izi ndi theka ya zomwe amkalandira mliliwu usanagwe

eng: After I pay the rent, I am left with almost nothing, he said. "The half salary doesn't do anything."
nya: Ndikathachotsapo ya renti,ndimatsala ndi chimodzimodzi opanda kanthu, iye anatero. "Ndalama ya pa mwezi yodulidwa thekayi simachita kanthu"

eng: His face lights up when describing how he makes ends meet by selling passion fruit — or grenadillas — that he buys from farmers near the border with Congo. He makes a small profit on every sack of fruit he sells in Kampala.
nya: Nkhope yake inawala ndi chimwemwe pofotooza momwe  amayesetsera kufikira zosowa zake za tsiku ndi tsiku pogulitsa chipatso cha magalagadeya chomwe amagura kwa alimi apafupi ndi malire oandikana ndi dziko la Congo.Kuchokera ku izi amapezapo cholowa chaching'ono pa thumba la chpatsochi chomwe amagulitsa ku Kampala.

eng: My business is still small. But I have a dream, he said. "If I can get someone to hold my hand, and give me a loan to expand my business, that's what I want. I am not waiting for the government to help me."
nya: Buzinesi yanga ikanali yaying'ono . Koma ndili ndi loto, iye anatero. " chomwe ndikufuna ndichakuti; nditapeza wina ondithandiza ndikundipatsa ngongole  yomwe ingathandizire bizinesi yangayi kukula. Ine sindikudikilira boma kuti lindithandize"

eng: Red Cross: 48,000 People Confirmed Missing Across Africa
nya: Red Cross: anthu 48,000 odziwika kuti anamusowa mmayiko osiyanasiyana mu Afruka

eng: The International Committee of the Red Cross says more than 48,000 people are missing across Africa, and at least 21,600 are minors. Most of the registered disappearances — widely believed to be a fraction of the continents wider, undocumented humanitarian tragedy — are linked to armed conflict, violence, disasters and migration across the continent.
nya: Bungwe la dziko lonse lapansi la Red Cros lati anthu opitilira 48,000 akusowa mmayiko osiyanasiyana mu Afrika, ndipo anthu osachpepera 21,600ndi ana. Kusowa komwe kunaikidwa mukaundura kwambili komwe kukukhulupililidwa ndi ambili kuti ndi gawo la afrika lalikulu chiphinjo cha anthu chosalemberedwa chikukhudzana ndi mikanganoyogwilitsa zida, ziwawa, ngozi komanso kusamuka kupita mbali zina za Afrika.

eng: The International Committee of the Red Cross says the number of people coming forward to report missing persons is on the rise in Africa.
nya: Komiti ya pa dziko lonse lapansi yati chiwerengero cha anthu omwe akubwera kudzanena za anthu osowa chikukwera ku Afrika.

eng: Amaya Fernandez, the humanitarian organizations adviser on the missing and their families for Western Africa, says the cause of the increasing numbers is two-fold.
nya: Amaya Fernandez, mlangizi pa zosowa kwa anthu  ndi mabanja awo wa mabungwe oona za anthu kumadzulo kwa Afrika,wati chopangitsa kukwera kwa chiwerengerochi kuli mbali ziwiri

eng: On one hand, [it's] due to the fact we are trying to register more systematically cases of missing persons throughout the region. But also, certainly, [it's] due to the increased violence and conflict experienced on the continent, which increases at the same time the likelihood of people going missing. Looking at our figures, almost half of the missing persons have been recorded underage and most of them are men. Among the women ... we can see that the majority are minors, she said.
nya: Mbali ina, ndi chifukwa cha kuyesetsa komwe tikupanga kuti titolere ndi kulemba nkhani za athu osowa mwa dongosolo mchigawo chonse.Komanso,mwachidziwikire ndi chifukwa cha kuchukukira kwa ziwawa ndi mikangano komwe kukuchitika mu chigawochi chomwe chikuchulutsa nthawi yomweyo kuthekera kokuti anthu atha kusowa. Kuyang'ana ma chiwerengero chomwe tili nacho, pafupifupi theka la anthu osowa ndi achichepere komanso ambili a iwo ndi anyamata. Pa gulu la akazi, titha kunena kuti ambili ndi ana achichepere., iye anatero

eng: The ICRC finding shows that 39,360 of the 48,000 missing people are from seven countries with armed conflicts.
nya: Zotsatira zopezedwa ndi a ICRC zikuonetsa kuti anthu okwana 36,360 pa 48,000 osowa ndi ochokera ku mayiko asanu ndi awiri omwe kuli kukangana ndi zida.

eng: According to the Stockholm International Peace and Research Institute, 20 countries in Africa have armed conflict. Out of the 20, 10 are witnessing high-intensity armed conflicts.
nya: Zotsatira zopezedwa ndi Stockholm International Peace and Research Institute,mayiko 20 mu Afrika kuli mikangano yokhudzana ndi zida. Pa mayiko 20wa, 10 ali muziwawa zazikulu.

eng: Fernandez says the ongoing conflict in some African countries has created more pain and suffering for families of missing persons.
nya: fErnandez wati kusamvetsetsana komwe kukuchitika mmayiko a ku Afrika kwapangitsa ululu komanso kuzunzika kwa mabanja a athu osowa

eng: Humanitarian consequences... caused by protracted armed conflicts are often... reflected in most of the interviews. For instance, half of the families interviewed in Nigeria reported that their relatives had gone missing in 2014-2015. [In] South Sudan, [the] majority of the families were looking for people that went missing between 2013 and 2016. In Libya, families reported that they were looking for missing relatives from the late '70s until the present day, and the same goes for families in Ethiopia and Uganda, she said.
nya: Zotsatira zokhudza uoyo waanthu zimene zimadza chifukwacha mikangano zimaonekera pocheza ndi munthu. Mwachitsanzo, theka la mabanja omwe tinacheza nawo ku Nigeria ananena kutiabael awo anasowa pakati pa zaka za 2014 ndi 2015. Ku mwera kwa dziko la Sudan , ambili mwa mabanja amasaka abale awo omwe anasowa pakati pa zaka za 2013 ndi 2016. Ku  dziko la Libya, mwabanja nanena kuti amkayang'ana abale omwe anasowa kuchokera kumapeto a zaka za mma 1970 mpaka lero, ndipo zomwe ndi momwe zinachitikira ndi mayiko a Ethiopia ndi Uganda," iye anatero

eng: Some experts see the need to train community workers and security agencies on the importance of information sharing to help locate missing persons.
nya: akatswiri ena akuona kufunika kwa kupphunzitsa ogwira ntchito mudera komanso timabungwe tachitetezo pa za ubwino wakugawana nkhani pothanidzira kupeza anthu osowa

eng: Zimbabwes assistant police commissioner Crispen Lifa says his country and the region need a data management system to follow up on the missing person cases.
nya: Othandizirwamkulu wa polise ku Zimbabwe, Crispen Lifa watidziko lake likufunika kaundura wamakono wopangira dongosolo za nkhani kuti apangire a kalondolondo a anthu osowa

eng: There is a need to have a database which should be continuously updated so that all missing persons, and even those that are deceased... is captured in a database by police stations. At the end of the day, that information has to be put in place... [so] if you want to check across the country the number of missing persons, [you] would quickly get that information from a central point, he said.
nya:
N'kofunika kukhala ndi kaundura amene azikonzedwa pafupifapi mowilikiza kuti anthu onse omwe anasowa komanson=iwo ameneanamwalira azisungidwa mu kaundura mu ma ofesi a polisi. Pa mapeto pake, zienezi zizisungidwa kuti ngati munthu ukufuna kusaka chiwerengero cha anthu osowa mu dziko lonse, uzitha kuzipeza nkhanizi kuchkera malo amodzi
Fauziya Hussein's brother went missing in June after a Kenyan court released him. 	Mchimwene wake wa Faziya Hussein anasowa atamasulidwa ndi bwalo la milandu la ku dziko la Kenya
The 39-year-old was accused of terrorism-related issues, but the court found him innocent and ordered the police to release him. His sister, Fauziya Hussein, says they never saw him again. 	Munthu wina wa zaka 39 akuzengedwa mulandu  okhudzana ndi nkhani zauchigawenga, koma bwalo lamilandu lamupeza iya osalakwa ndip lalamula apolisi kuti amumasule. Mchemali wake, Fauziya Hussein,  anati sanamuonenso kachikena.
I know they still have him. At every point [of his detention], my brother got a chance to make a phone call. He called my mother. So, if he was released, why didnt he call my mother? So, I know for a fact they did not release him," she said.
column3: Ndikudziwa anakali nayebe. Pamulingo  wake wina ulionse ofufua,  mchimwene wanga  anapea mwayi oimba lamya. Anawaimbira mayi wanga. Ndiye ngati anamasulidwa, ndichifukwa chani anawimbira mayi wamga? Ndiye ndikudziwa chifukwa chake chimene sanamumasulire iye,  anatero.

eng: According to Hussein, police told her they released her brother.
nya: Kumbali ya Hussein, apolisi anamuuza iye kuti mchimwene wake  amumasula.

eng: The ICRC calls on African governments to prevent disappearances and help with search and identification, and addressing families needs.
nya: Bungwe la ICRC  linamema maboma amu Africa kuti apewe kusowa komanso kuthandizira kuyang'ana ndikuzindikira, komanso kuthandizira zofunikira za mabanja.

eng: Olympics: Post-Bolt Era in 100m Begins in Tokyo
nya: Masewero kutsogolo kwa nthawi ya Bolt mu liwiro la 100m  ayamba ku Tokyo

eng: The post-Usain Bolt era in the men's Olympic 100 meters began on Saturday in Tokyo with Dorian Keletela, who is competing as part of the Olympic Refugee team, advancing to the next round with a personal best 10.33 seconds.
nya: Masewero a kutsogolo kwa nthawi ya Usain Bolt mu liwiro la a zibamo autali okwana 100m anayamba Loweluka ku Tokyo ndi Dorian Keletela,  amene akupikisana nawo ngati gawo la gulu losewera othawa kwawo lotchedwa Olympic Refugee team, kupitilira ku mlingo wina atachita bwino kupitilira ena ndi mphindi zokwana 10.33.

eng: Bolt won three straight titles from Beijing in 2008 and his retirement in 2017 has left something of a vacuum in the showpiece athletics event, with no one stepping up to fill the Jamaican's shoes.
nya: Bolt anachita bwino mkupezapo zikho zitatu motsogoza kuchokera ku Beijing mu chaka cha 2008 ndipo kupuma pa ntchito kwake chifukwa cha kukula mu chaka cha 2017 kwasiya mpata mumasewera othamanga pamene palibe munthu ewe akufikira pamene mzika ya dziko la Jamaica yi imafikira.

eng: On Saturday, amid stifling temperatures that hovered above 30 degrees Celsius, sprinters took the track as they began their attempts to succeed world-record holder Bolt.
nya: Loweluka mkatikati mwa nyengo yotentha yomwe kutentha kwake kunafika 30degree celcius, ma Sprinters anayambapo kuyesera kupambana pomwe Bolt anafika pamene palibe wina anafikapo pa dziko lonse lapansi.

eng: Keletela, 22, is one of those athletes.
nya: Keletela wa zaka 22 ndi mmodzi mwa othamangawa

eng: Originally from the Democratic Republic of the Congo, he moved to Portugal in 2016 following the death of his parents due to conflict in his homeland and ran a personal best 10.33 to advance to the next round later on Saturday.
nya: Kwawo kwenikweni ndi ku Democratic Replublic of Congo, iye anasamukira ku dziko la Portugal mu chaka cha 2016 makolo ake atamwalirachifukwa cha kusamvana ku mudzi kwawo ndipo anathamanga mulimbikira nafika yekha mwansanga ndi mphindi zokwana 10.33 kuti apitilire patsogolo loweluka

eng: I am very, very proud of this and I am very, very proud of this team. It gives me a lot of strength to go on, Keletela said after the race. "You can do ... anything, whether you are a refugee or not."
nya: Ndine wonyadira pa ichi ndipo ndine onyadiira team iyi. Imandipatsa mphamvu zambili kuti ndizipitilira, anatero Keletela atatha liwiroli. aliyense atha kuchita chili chonse kaya ndi othawa kwawo kaya ayi siothawa kwawo."

eng: Others who progressed from the preliminary heats include Zimbabwe's Ngoni Makusha, who got off the block fast to win his heat in 10.32, and Oman's Barakat Al Harthi, who posted 10.27s to win his race.
nya: Magulu ena omwe anadutsa ku mto woyambawu anali Ngoni makusha a ku Zimbabwe, omwe anafika mwa nsanga ndi mphindi zokwana 10.32, komanso Oman's Barakat Al Harthi, omwe anafika pa mphindi 10.27

eng: There were three preliminary heats overall and the first three in each heat qualify to round one, along with the athlete who posts the next fastest time.
nya: Panali maulendo atatu ndipo magulu atatu oyambilira mu ulendo ulionse anachita bwino kupita ulendo woyamba limodzi ndi wothamanga amene wafikiranthawi ya changu inayo.

eng: The world's top sprinters enter the equation later Saturday, with the United States, who have won more golds in the event than all other nations combined, determined to take Bolt's mantle and regain their supremacy.
nya: Akatswiri a liwiro pa dziko lonse ayamba nawo kupikisana tsiku loweruka, pamene dziko la United states, lomwe linawina zikho za golide kuposa maiko ena onse kuphatikiza, lili ndi chidwi kuti litenge ukatswiri kwa Bolt ndikukhazikitsanso ukulu wawo.

eng: Their last gold medal win in the event came via Justin Gatlin in 2004.
nya: Mendulo yawo ya golide ya ulendo wapitawo inabwera kudzera mwa Justin Gatli mu chakacha 2004

eng: Contenders include Trayvon Bromell, whose 9.77 second run in Florida last month is the fastest of the year and propels him into the top tier of favorites in the race.
nya: Olimbana naye ndiye Trayvon Bromell, amene kuthamanga kwakekwa mphindi 9.77ku Floridamwezi wathawu ndiye wliwiro lachangu paonse mu chaka chimenechi ndipo ichi chikumukankhira mu gulu la anamateture okondedwa mu liwiro

eng: His compatriot Ronnie Baker is probably his closest rival for podium positions and finished second to him at the U.S. trials with a time of 9.85.
nya: Mzika ya dziko lake, Ronnie Baker, ndiamene ali opikisana naye kwambiri popambana ndipo anakhala wachiwiri kwa iye pa mpikisano waku U.S ndi nthawi yokwanira 9.85

eng: Canada's Andre De Grasse, who won bronze in the 100m in Rio five years ago, will be looking to go for the title this time around while South African sprinter Akani Simbine, fifth in Brazil and boasting the second-fastest time of the year, will also be in the running.
nya: Andre De Grasse wa ku Canada,amene anapeza chikho cha mkuwa(bronze) mu liwilo la 100m ku Rio zaka zisanu zapitazo, akakhala akuyang'anira kupita kukapeza chikho ulendo uno pamene Akani SIMBI WA KU South Africa , wachisanu ku Brazil komanso akuipatsa moto ulendo wachiwiri

eng: Bolt's former training partner, 2012 silver medalist Yohan Blake, the second-fastest man in history, will carry his nation's hopes on his shoulders.
nya: Mzake wa wakale wa Bolt wokonzekerera naye,amene mu chaka cha 2012 antega chikho kapena mendulo  ya siliva, Yohan Blake, wachiwili othanga liwiro mu mbiri, akanyamura chiyembekezo cha dziko lake pa mapewa ake.

eng: Zimbabwe Opening Victoria Falls to Vaccinated Tourists
nya: Zimbabwe ikutsegulira Victoria falls kwa alendo aku mayiko akunja omwe anabaitsa katemera

eng: Zimbabwe is opening popular tourism destination Victoria Falls to visitors who have been vaccinated against COVID-19, in a move welcomed by the countrys suffering tourism industry.  Late Tuesday after a Cabinet meeting, Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa told reporters that the government had resolved to lift a lid on Victoria Falls, the tallest waterfall in the world and the countrys top tourism destination.
nya: Zimbabwe ikutsegula malo otchuka okopa alendo a ku mayiko a kunja Kwa alendo omwe analandira katemera wa COVID 19, mu zochitika zomwe zalandilidwa ndi gawo lokopa alendo lomwe lavutika. Patatha mkumano wa nduna za boma madzuo a lachiwiri, nduna youlutsa nkhani, a Monica Mutsvangwa anauza atolankhani kuti boma laganiza kuti lichotse chotchinga pa Victoria Falls, omwe ndi dziwe lalitali pa dzikolonse lapansi lomwelimakopa alendo ambili mu dzikolo.

eng: [The] Cabinet acceded to a request by the tourism industry to open the Victoria Falls and Kazungula Border posts to tourists who are fully vaccinated. This is in view of the realization that over 60% of the population in Victoria Falls has been vaccinated. The lockdown measures, however, are being enforced throughout the country in order to curtail a surge under the third wave of COVID-19, Mutsvangwa said.   Godfrey Koti, spokesman for the Zimbabwe Tourism Authority, says the pandemic had brought the tourism industry worldwide to its knees. He says it is time for Zimbabwe to begin the long climb back with the opening up of Victoria Falls, within the confines and guidelines of the COVID-19 pandemic.   "And from a regional perspective, the tourism traffic will grow and this will send a very strong message to our source markets. This is a definite way of showing, of a benefit being shown from [the] governments drive of vaccinating the entire city of Victoria Falls and subsequently Victoria Falls reaching herd immunity. So, we are very excited to see this happening and it can only show that we are definitely moving in the right direction," Koti said.   About 1.5 million Zimbabweans out of a population of 14 million have received their first vaccination shot, and nearly 695,000 have received their second inoculation.
nya: Ndunazi zamva pempho la gawo la zokopa alendo kuti atsegure Victoria falls komanso chipata cha mmalire cha Kazungula kwa alendo omwe analandira katemera mokwanira. Chiganizochi chabwera poona kuti anthu oposera 60 pa anthu 100 aliwonse okhala ku Victoria falls analandira katemera. Komabe njira zopewera mliliwu zomwe zinabwera ndi kutseka kwa zipata zikupitilira kutsatilidwa dziko lonse pofuna kupewa kukula kwa mliliwu maka mumtundu wachitatu wake," anatero Mtsvangwa. Godfrey Koti, oyankhulira Zimbabwe Tourism Authority wati mliliwu unagwetsa gawo la zokopa alendo pa dziko lonse . Anatindi nthawi yoti Zimbabwe iyambe kuzitolera kubwerera patali pomwe inagwa pa kutsegulidwa kwa Victoria falls, mkatikati mwa kutsata njira zopewera mlili wa COVID 19. "Poyang'anira mbali ya chigawo, kuenda kwa aendo kukula ndipo izi zipeleka uthenga komanso chithuzithuzi cha mphamvu kwa otitsatira malonda athu.Iyi ndi njira yoonetsa, yopindulitsa konetsedwa kuchokera kufunitsitsa kwa boma kuti abaye katemera anthu onse a ku Voictoriafalls potsatira izi Victoria falls kulimba ku mliliwu.Choncho ndife okondwera kwambili poona izi zikuchitika ndipo zikoonetsa kuti tikupita njira yoyenera," antero Koti. Pafupifupi anthu1.5 ochokeramu chiwerengero cha Zimbabwe cha 14 million alandira katemera wawo woyamba, ndipo pafupifupi 695,000 alandira wachiwiri

eng: Clement Mukwasi, a spokesman for Shearwater, one of the tourism operators in Victoria Falls, sounded an optimistic tone.  "It is the industrys hope that towards the end of the pandemic – which we think we are in – there shall be some credit lines extended to the industry for the industry to recover. We applaud the government for taking our call to open the borders of Zambia and Botswana because Victoria Falls has reached its herd immunity. We are hoping that in addition to opening the borders, they are also going to set up a policy on how people should flow across all three countries," he said.  Mukwasi said those who are vaccinated should be allowed to move across the country without any problem, while those who are not vaccinated should produce results showing they have tested negative for the coronavirus, which causes the COVID-19.  Zimbabwe currently has 101,711 confirmed coronavirus infections and 3,280 deaths, according to Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.   The government says the vaccination program will intensify after the arrival of more doses from China in the coming days. The number of cases has been rising, as the delta variant becomes more widespread.
nya: Clement Mukwasi, oankhulira a Shearwater,amodzimwa oyendetsa Victoria Falls, anamveka ndi chiyembekezo chabwino. "Ndi chiyembekezo cha gawo la zoona alendoli kuti mapeto a mliliwu-omwe tikuganiza kuti tafikamo- kudzakhala mpata wopatsidwa ngongole zopelekedwa ku gawoli kuti libwerere. Tikuyamikira boma pokumva pempho lathu kuti atsigure zipata zolowera mdziko muno za dziko la Zambia ndi Botswanachifukwa Victoria falls ndiyotetezekakwa thunthu. Tikuyembekeza kuti pamwamba pa kutsegura zipata ayikanso mfundo kapena lamulo la momwe anthu aziyendera polowa mmayiko atatu onsewa.,"anatero. Mukwasi anati iwo amene anabayidwa aloledwe kuyenda polowa ndikutuluka mdzikoli opanda mavuto pamene iwo amenen sanabayitse aziyamba aonetsa zotsatira zoikira umboni kuti alibe kapena sanapezeke ndi kachilombo ka corona kamene kamayambitsanthenda ya COVID-19. Zimbabwe ili ndi anthu okwana 101,711 omwe anapezeka ndi matenda oyambitsidwa ndi kachilombo ka Corona komanso anthu 3,280 omwe anamwalira ndi mliliwu potengera zotsatira  zomwe zinapezedwa ndi a Hopkins University omwe akuutsata mlili wa dziko lonsewu. Boma lati ndondomeko yobayitsa katemera ikura mankhwala ena akangofika kuchokera ku dziko la China mu masiku ali mkudzawo. Chiwelengero cha nathu opezeka ndi mliliwu chikuchulukira pamene tundu wa delta ukufalikira kwambili.

eng: UNHCR Voices Concern After Botswana Deports Zimbabwean Refugees
nya: UNHCR Voices yokhudzidwa dziko la Botswana litabweza anthu othawa kwawo a ku Zimbabwe

eng: The Office of the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) says it is concerned after Botswana deported 57 Zimbabwean refugees who had lived in the host country since 2008. The refugees reportedly failed to register for voluntary repatriation, which led to their forced removal late last week.   The UNHCRs external relations officer, Kate Pond, says the refugees, irrespective of their status, have rights and could have been allowed to remain as permanent residents.  "UNHCR remains concerned that Zimbabweans who have been in Botswana for over a decade have been removed to Zimbabwe in less than voluntary circumstances. Irrespective of their status they still have certain rights, and UNHCR had aimed for alternative solutions, like those provided to Zimbabweans who have family links in Botswana and may be able to remain in the country as permanent residents," Pond said.  One of the deported refugees, speaking on condition of anonymity, says they were rounded up Thursday and told to board a bus which took them to Zimbabwes border.  "We left Botswana on empty stomachs. We were deported to the border and we didnt get any assistance. We wanted to remain in Botswana; thats why we did not register [for repatriation]. We have nothing, we dont know where to start. We had children going to school. It will be difficult without documents like passports and identity cards," the refugee said.  The deportees had been living at the Dukwi refugee camp. Botswanas government had warned that refugees who did not register would be deported.   Last month, Botswana sent back more than 200 other Zimbabweans who had registered for voluntary repatriation.  The repatriated refugees had initially refused to do so, citing fears of persecution in their homeland.  Most were opposition activists whose homes were burned down during a deadly presidential election campaign in 2008.  But one of the returnees, Bheki Weza, says they have surprisingly been well received in Zimbabwe despite their earlier safety concerns.  "We are very happy about the situation. As we speak, I am now home still trying to settle down and adjust to the difficult economic conditions here in Zimbabwe. But I am happy because there is still peace surrounding us. I have met with the chiefs and even met with people that we fought with before I left. So far so good," Weza said.  The UNHCR says it will continue to assist refugees who were repatriated. Each person received $520 and a food package. But the agency says there will be no such assistance for the deported refugees.
nya: Ofesi  ya U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) ndiyokhudzika pamene dziko la botswana linathamangitsa anthu othawa kwawo aku zimbabwe omwe akhala m'dziko lawo kuyambira 2008. Anthu othawa kwawowa analephera kulembetsa mwakufuna kwawo kuti abwerere kwawo, zomwe zinapangitsa kuchotsedwa kwawo mokakamizakumapeto kwa sabata yathayi. wa pampando oyang'anira ma ubale akunja wa UNHCR (external relations officer) Kate Pond wati anthu othawa kwawowa kupatura momwe iwo analili, ali ndi ufulu wachibadidwe ndipo akanaloledwa kukhala ku dzikolo kwa muyaya. "UNHCR ndiyokhudzikabe kuti anthu a kuZimbabwe omwe anakhala ku Botswana kwa zaka zopitilira khumi(10) achotsedwa kubwerera ku Zimbabwe osati mwa kufuna kwawo.Kupatura kuti anthuwa anali motani, anthuwa akanali ndi ma ufulu enabe ndipo UNHCR inakakonda njira zina zokonzera zinthu  monga momwe zimakhalira ndi anthu ena a ku Zimbabwe omwe ali ndi abale ku Botswana kuti athe kukhazikikabe mdzikomo, "anatero Pond. Mmodzi mwa anthu othamangitsidwawa, yemwe anayankhura ndipo anakana kudziulura, anati anamasulidwa  lachinayi ndipo anauzidwa  kuti akakwere basi yomwe iwatengele iwo kuchipata cha Zimbabwe. " Tinachoka ku Botswana ndi njala.Tinatumizidwa ku chipata ndipo sitinapeze thandizo lina lililonse. Timkafuna kukhalabe ku Botswana; ndichifukwa sitinalembetse( kuti tibwelele kwathu.).  Tilibe kalikonse, sitikudziwa pokayambira, tinali ndi ana omwe amapita ku sukulu. Zikakhala zovutachifukwa chosakhala ndi zitupa ngati  chitupa coyendera mmaiko komanso zitupa zazizindikiro(ID), " anatero mmodzi mwa othawa kwawoyu.Othamangitsidwawa akhala akukhara kumalo osungirako anthu othawa kwawo kotchedwa Dukwi refugee camp.Boma la Botswana linachenjeza iwo othawa maiko akwawo kuti ngati salembetsa adzathamangitsidwa. Mwezi watha Dziko La Botswana linatumiza kwawo anthu ena oposera 200 adziko la Zimbabwe omwe analembetsa mwakufuna kwawo zakubwelera  kudziko lakwawo. Anthu othawa dziko lakwawo ofuna kubwelerawa koyamba anakana, akuti chifukwa cha mantha akuzunzidwa mudziko lakwawo. Ambiri anali otsutsa boma amene nyumba zawo zinaotchedwa munthawi yoopsa ya  misonkhano yokopa anthu paudindo wa mtsogoleri wa dziko mu chaka cha 2008. Koma mmodzi mwa  obwelera, Bheki Weza, anati anadabwa atalandilidwa bwino  mu dziko la Zimbabwe mosiyana ndi nkhawa zomwe analinazo za chitetezo koyambilira. "Ndife okondwa kwambiri ndimmene zinthu zilili. Pomwe ndikunena pano,  Ndili kunyumba  stopano kuyesa kukhazikika komanso kudzikonzekeretsa  kunyengo zovuta za chuma zomwe zili kuno ku Zimbabwe. Komabe ndine okondwa chifukwa pali mtendere pakati pathu. Ndakumana ndi mafumu komanso ndakumana ngakhale ndi anthu ena omwe timkamenyana nawo tisanachoke. Pakadali pano zilibwino, anatero Weza. Bungwe la UNHRC  lati lipitiliza kuthandiza anthu othawa maiko akwawo omwe anabwelera kwawo. Munthu aliyense walandira $520 komanso phukusi la chakudya. koma othandizawa ati sipadzikhara thandizo  loeteri kwa  anthu othawa kwawo omwe athamangitsidwawa.

eng: Zimbabwe's Food Insecurity Escalates During COVID-19 Lockdowns
nya: Kusowa kwa chakudya kwakula ku Zimbabwe nthawi yakutseka zipata chifukwa cha COVID 19

eng: A new report from Zimbabwes government says hunger and food insecurity have increased during the coronavirus pandemic. The World Food Program says the problem is especially acute for unemployed residents of the cities.
nya: Uthenga wa tsopano kuchokera ku boma la Zimbabwe watinjalandi kusowa kwa chakudya zakulamu nthawi ya mlili wa kachilombo ka corona. Bengwe la World Food Program lati vutolindi lalikulu kwa anthu a mmizinda omwe samagwira ntchito.

eng: The government report, called the Zimbabwe Vulnerability Assessment, says about 2.4 million people in the countrys urban areas are struggling to meet their basic food needs because of lockdowns to contain the spread of COVID-19.
nya: Uthenga otumizidwa ndi boma otchedwa Zimbabwe Vunurability Assessment, wati anthu pafupifupi 2.4 million okhala mmizinda ya ku tauni akuvutika kuti apeze zosowa zachakudya cha tsiku ndi tsiku chifukwa cha ziletso komanso kutseka kwa zipata ndi cholinga chopewa kufala kwa COVID 19.

eng: Murambiwa Simon Mushongorokwa, 61, used to get casual jobs in the factories before the lockdowns began.
nya: Murambiwa Simon Mushongorokwa wa zaka 61 amkapeza ku ma fakitale ziletsondi kutseka kwa zipata kusanachitike

eng: I used to get about $30 a week, he said. "It was not enough for my needs. But when the lockdown came, it got worse, until I started growing mushrooms. Its slowly improving my life, if the market prices improve, we will survive."
nya: Ndimkapeza  $30 pa sabata, iye anatero. "Ndalamai siyinali yokwanira kuchotsa zofunika za pa moyo wanga. Koma pamene ziletso ndikutsek akwa zipata zitafika zinthu zinapitilira kuonongeka mpaka pamene ndinayamba ulimi wa bowa. Izi pang'ono ndi pang'ono zikusintha moyo wanga bwino. Ngati mitengo ya ku msika ingasinthe, tipulumuka."

eng: He uses forage from his backyard corn and sorghum field to grow the mushrooms. He says he now gets about $5 a week from selling them and uses some for consumption with his wife and five dependents.
nya: Akuti amagwilitsa ntchito mapesi a chimanga ndi mapira omwe ali nawo pakhomo pake kuseli podzalira bowa. Akuti tsopano amapeza  $5 pa sabata akagulitsa bowandipo amagwilitsira ntchito pakhomo iye, mkazi wake ndi ena omwe amadalira iye.

eng: Simon Julius Kufakwevanhu, an official from a local NGO, has been teaching people in a poor suburb to grow mushrooms.
nya: Simon Julius Kufakwevanhu amene ndi ogwira ntchito ku bungwe lomwe silaboma la mudera mwake wakhalaakuphunzitsa anthu a mmadera ovutika kuti adzilima bowa.

eng: No media source currently available
nya: palibe tsamba la mchezo la intaneti lomwe lilipo pakanali pano

eng: Before the introduction of mushroom farming in this place, it was very tough for people in this community to survive because of the lockdowns and so forth. But when The Future of Hope [a nonprofit committed to skills empowerment] brought in mushroom growing, its changing because you can now buy something, able to go to shops and buy mielie meal [coarse flour], sugar and so forth. Even if I fall sick I can go to the hospital after selling mushrooms, he said.
nya: Kusanabwere ulimi wabowa kuno, kunali kovuta kwa anthu mdera lino kuti azipeza zosowa zawoza tsiku ndi tsikuchifukwa cha ziletso zobwera chifukwa cha covid 19 ndi zina zotere. Bungwe la The Future of Hope(bungwe lomwe silipeza phindu potukula za luso), linabweretsa ulimi wabowa omwe wasintha miyoyo ya anthu , zinthu zikusintha chifukwa pano munthu utha kugura chithu, utha kupita kumalo ogulitsira zinthu mkukagura ufa wopera, shuga ndi zina zotero. Ngakhale nditadwala nditha kupita ku chipatala nditatha kugulitsa bowa, iye anatero.

eng: The World Food Program says it is looking for more ideas and resources to help 550,000 people like Mushongorokwa in urban areas get basic food for survival.
nya: Bungwe la World Food Program likusakasakabe mfundo zambili komanso zipangizo zothandizira anthu 550,000 omwe ali ngati Mushongorokwa mmadera a kutauni kuti azipeza zofunikira pa moyo wawo wa tsiku ndi tsiku.

eng: Tomson Phiri, head of communications at the World Food Program, speaking from his base Geneva, said, "COVID-19 has not only wiped out lives, it has wiped out livelihoods as well. The number of people who are unable to put food on their table in Zimbabwes urban areas has increased from 30 percent during the same period in 2019 to 42 percent right now."
nya: A Tomson Phiri omwe ndi wa mkulu pankhani za kulumikizana ku bungwe laWorld Food Program poyankhura ndi a Geneva wati " COVID 19 sanachotse chabe miyoyo, wachotsanso zothandizira kukhala moyonso. Chiwerengero cha anthu a ku Zimbabwe omwe ali ndi kuthekera kopeza chakudya ku madera a ku tauni chakwera kuchoka pa anthu 30 kufika pa anthu 42 pa athu 100 aliwonse (chakwera ndi anthu 12 pa anthu hundred aliwonse) mu nyengo omweyi mu 2019.

eng: Zimbabwe's government says it is giving about $12 a month to families affected by lockdowns. Thats nowhere near the $500 an average family of five to seven people needs to survive each month.
nya: Boma la Zimbabwe lati likupeleka $12 pa mwezi kwa mabanja omwe akhudzika ndi ziletso za COVID 19. Izi zili kutali ndi $500 pamomwe mlingo wa banja woyelekezeka womwe ndi anthu 5 kapena 7 kuti ikwaniritse zosowa zawo.

eng: People like Mushongorokwa hope that with the lockdowns recently eased, jobs and livelihoods will come back.
nya: Anthu ngati Mushongorokwa ali ndi chiyembekezo chakuti kukhwefulidwa kwa ziletso komwe kwapangidwa pakatipa, ntchito komanso miyoyo ibwerera mchimake.

eng: In the meantime, the WFP is seeking $32 million to feed food-insecure urbanites.
nya: Pakanali pano. Bungwe la WFP likusaka $32 million kuti idetse anthu okhala mmatauni osowa chakudya.

eng: South Africa's Zuma to Pursue Private Prosecution Against Prosecutor
nya: Zuma wa ku South Africa aimba mlandu oimirira boma

eng: Former South African President Jacob Zuma is pursuing private prosecution proceedings to remove the lead prosecutor in an arms deal corruption trial after failed legal challenges, his foundation said on Sunday.
nya: Mtsogoleri wopuma wa dziko la South Africa akufuna  kuzenga mlandu ochotsa oimilira boma wamkulu pa kuyankha mlandu wa mgwilizano wa katangale wogula zida za nkhondo atalephera zopinga zamalamuro zomwe zinawalaka, bungwe lake linanena choncho la mulungu.

eng: Last month the Supreme Court of Appeal (SCA) torpedoed Zuma's latest bid to have lead prosecutor Billy Downer taken off the case after accusing him of bias and leaking of confidential information to a journalist in contravention of the national prosecution act, among other complaints.
nya: Mwezi watha bwalo lalikulu la milandu la Supreme Court of Appeal (SCA) linaononga cholinga cha Zuma chomwe amafuna kuchotsa otsogolera mlandu wa boma dzina lake Bill Downer pomuneneza kuti anali okondera komanso anatulutsa nkhani ya chinsinsi kumpatsa mtolankhani zomwe zili zotsutsana ndi lamulo la dziko kukhudzana ndi oimba mlandu, pamwamba pa zodandaura zina.

eng: The SCA dismissed the application for leave to appeal on the grounds that there is no reasonable prospect of success and there is no other compelling reason why an appeal should be heard.
nya: SCA inakana pempho lochotsalo kuti apemphe pa chifukwa chakuti palibe chiyembekezo chanzeru chakumbana komanso palibe chifukwa champhamvu chopaangitsa dandaulolo limveredwe

eng: The spokesman of the Jacob Zuma Foundation, Mzwanele Manyi told a press briefing that Zuma's instructions to his legal team to institute private prosecution "will now be put into operation in the next few days."
nya: Oyankhula mmalo mwa Jacob Zuma Foundation, Mzwanele Manyi ananena pa mkumano woulutsa nkhani kuti langizo la Zuma kwa omuimilira mlandu ake kuti aimbe mlandu " tsopano lichitika mu masiku ochepa akudzawa,"

eng: He also said Zuma's legal team has filed a reconsideration application to the president of the SCA, a petition to hear the appeal.
nya: Iye ananenanso kuti gulu loimilira mlandu Zuma lalembera kuganiziraponso pa dandaulo kwa mtsogoleri waSCA, dandaulo Lkuti atchere khutu ku pempho lawo.

eng: Zuma, who was ousted from the ruling African National Congress in 2018 after nearly two decades as president, has pleaded not guilty to charges of corruption, money laundering and racketeering in the long-running case over the $2 billion arms deal in the 1990s.
nya: Zuma amene anatulutsidwa ku chipani cholamulira boma cha African Congress mu 2018 patatha zaka pafupifupi makumi awiri(20) ali mtsogoleri wapezeka wosalakwa pa milandu ya katangale, kupanga ndalama zambili mosayenera komanso kupanga malonda osayenera komanso achinyengo mu mlandu womwe wakhala ukayenda kwa kanthawipanjhani ya kugura zida za nkhodndo mwa chinyengo mu zaka za m'ma 1990.

eng: The deal case has dogged Zuma since he was sacked as deputy president of the country in 2005. He said he was the victim of a political witch-hunt.
nya: Mlanduwu unamkakamira Zuma pakuti anachotsedwa ngati wachiwiri kwa mtsogoleri wa dzikomu chaka cha 2005. Iye anati anakhudzidwa chifukwa chakulondana mu ndale

eng: On Monday the long-delayed trail is set to get underway and Zuma will be present in court.
nya: Lolemba, mlandu womwe watenga nthawi kuti anthu aonekere ku bwalo la milandu wakonzeka kuti uyambikendipo Zuma akapezeka ku bwalo lamilanduko

eng: Manyi said Zuma, who turns 80 on Tuesday, is applying for a postponement because "it is very clear that the conditions for a fair trail are non-existent."
nya: Mani anati Zuma amaene akukwanitsa zaka 80 zakubadwa lachiwilili, akulemba pempho losintha masiku kupita patsogolo chifukwa " zikuchita kuonekeratu kuti zinthu zopangitsa kumva mlandu mwachilungamo palibepo"

eng: On Monday his team will also respond to the supplementary affidavit served by the National Prosecution Authority where they seek to introduce new evidence in the trial.
nya: Lolemba gulu lake ayankha kalata yolembedwa ndi malumbiro yomwe inalembedwa ndi bungwe la National Prosecution Authority pamene akufuna kupeza umboni watsopano pa kuyesedwa mu mlanduwu

eng: All His Excellency President Zuma really wants is his day in court, in a fair trial and certainly not in a forum which is being rigged by the State, Manyi said.
nya: Chimene olemekezeka mtsogoleri Zuma akufunitsitsa ndilakukhala ndi tsiku lake ku bwalo lamilandu, kuyesedwa mwachilungamo komansomumkumano omwe sukutulutsidwa mosaloledwa ndi boma Mani antero

eng: South Africa’s Neutral Stance on Russia Risks International Ties: Analysts
nya: South Africa ilibe mbali pa nkhani yomwe Russia akuika pa chiopsezo ma ubale apa dziko lonse la pansi: ozukuta

eng: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Monday defended his neutral stance on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling for talks — not condemnation.
nya: goleri wa dziko la South Africa a Cyril Ramaphosa lolemba anaonetsa kusatenga mbali kwake pamene Russia yalowa ndi aslikali, kuitanitsa kuyankhurana osati kutsutsa

eng: Critics have blasted the government for failing to support Ukraine against its neighbor. Analysts say South Africa is allowing historic political and economic ties with Moscow to risk relations with the rest of the world.
nya: Odzudzula anena motsutsana ndi boma polephera kuthamndizira dziko la Ukraine  motsutsana ndi dziko loyandikana nalo. Ozukuta nkhani ati dziko la South Africa likulora mbili ya maubale ndale ndichuma mogwirizna ndi dziko la Moscow kuika pa chiopsezo ma ubalendi dziko lonse la pansi.

eng: Negotiation rather than weapons or economic pressure is the mechanism Ramaphosa would like to see used to settle the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
nya: Njira imene Ramaphosa akufuna itachitika pokonza kusamvana kwa pakati pa Russia ndi Ukraine ndi kukambilana osati kugwilitsa ntchito zida kapena kusokonezana pa chuma

eng: Ramaphosas unwavering stance overruled an earlier call by the countrys international relations department for Russia to withdraw its forces.
nya: Ganizo losatekeseka lomwe Ramaphosa watenga lakana pempho lomwe gawo loyang'anira za maubale ndi maiko a kunja la dzikolo la International realtions department kuti Russia ichotse agulu la nkhondo lake.

eng: Leaza Jernberg is a Johannesburg-based independent researcher and consultant on diplomacy.
nya: Leaza Jernberg amakhala ku Johannesburg ndipo amapanga kafukufuku moziimira paekha okhudzana ndi ma ubale a kunja kwa dziko.

eng: The Department of International Relations and Cooperation, [which] is largely the diplomat for South Africa, their initial instinct was to say, ‘Well, this was not acceptable. And that was kind of pulled back by the president who I think has this concern about allies and Russian and what this looks like, Jernberg said. "So even within South Africa, South Africa's position is very contested, even within government."
nya: Gawo laInternational Relations and Cooperation lomwe limaona ma ubala a mayiko a kunja kwa South Africa, zomwe anaganiza poyambilira zinali kuti 'iziz ndizosayenera. Ndipo is mu njira ina zinabwezedwa ndi mawu a mtsogoleri wa dzikolo amene ndikuganiza ali ndi ganizo la mgwilizano ndi Russia ndi momwe izi zikuonekera, Jernberg anatero. "Choncho mkati mwa South Africa momwe, mbali ya dzikoli ndilotsutsidwa, ngakhale mu boma momwemo."

eng: South Africas ties to Russia stretch back to the 1960s when the Soviet Union gave support to anti-apartheid freedom fighters.
nya: Ubale wa South Africa ndi Russia ikuchokera mu zaka za ma 1960 pamene mgwirizano wa Soviet Union unapeleka thandizo kwa anthu amene amamenyera ufulu kutsutsana ndi kusalana chifukwa cha mtundu

eng: In subsequent years, politicians, including those from the ruling party, the African National Congress, maintained close ties with Russia.
nya: Mu zaka zotsatira, a ndale kuphatikizipa a chipani cholamulira cha the African National Congress, anakhalabe mu ubale ndi Russia.

eng: Which is why analysts said its no surprise that a foundation headed by former president Jacob Zuma has voiced support for Russias Vladimir Putin.
nya: Ichi ndi chifukwa chake akatswiri ozukuta nkhani anati sizodabwitsa kuti maziko mwe anaikidwa ndi mtsogoleri wa kale Jacob Zuma ayankhula mogwirizana  ndi mtsogoleri wa Russia Vladimir Putin

eng: Richard Calland is a public law professor at the University of Cape Town.
nya: university of Capetown

eng: He [Putin] had a very close relationship with our former President, Jacob Zuma, Calland said. "It was a corrupt relationship. It fueled an illegal in the end, the court said, illegal procurement of Russian nuclear power, which was stopped by the courts. And I fear that that interferes at least with some political attitudes in South Africa. But I don't believe that it was the direct reason for the position that South Africa has taken."
nya: Ie (Putin)

eng: Instead, Calland says, South African officials are simply following the countrys standard position on foreign conflicts.
nya: Mmalo mwake, Calland anati, ogwirira ntchito dziko la South Africa akungotsatira mlingo oyikidwa ndi dzikolo pa nkhani ya mikangano ya kunja.

eng: I'm well acquainted with and in close contact with South Africa's kind of senior diplomatic officials, and they are very steeped in this tradition of non-alignment, Calland said. "Political dialogue is their middle name, so to speak. And I think that on this one, they wanted to maintain this kind of nonpartisan position in order to promote that dialogue."
nya: Ndimadziwa bwino komaanso ndili pafupi ndi anthu oona za ma ubale ndi maiko a kunja, ndipo anakhazikika mu chikhalidwe chimenechi chosagwirizana ndi maiko ena,anatero Calland. "kukambilana mu ndale ndilo dina lawo lina ponena mu njira ina.Ndipo ndikuganiza kuti pa ichi, amafuna kupitilira kusatenga mbali ndi cholinga  cholimbikitsa kukambilana.

eng: Another factor at play is the countrys position within the economic bloc, BRICS, which includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa.
nya:
Chifukwa china chopangitsa dzikoli kusaonetsa mbali mumkatikati mwa mgwirizano wa chuma wotchedwa BRICS, momwe muli mayiko a Brazil, Russia, India, China ndi South Africa.
Analysts said South Africa may be attempting to maintain trade relations with Russia and China. 	Katswiri anati dziko la South Africa litha kukhala kuti likufuna kusunga ubale wa malonda ndi mayiko a Russiandi China
But international relations expert Jernberg said that stance is ultimately counterproductive. 	Koma katswiri pa ma ubale a mayiko a kinja Jeneberg anati ganizo ili ndilobwezeretsa mmbuyo kupindura kapena losapinduitsa.
In that case, we're actually backing the wrong horse," Jernberg said. "When you look at the EU, the European Union as a block, South Africas combined trade to the European Union is actually far larger. And so then if you're going to make an economic argument, you should surely be arguing that between the United States and between, and Europe, is actually a greater economic interest."
column3: Kotero tikutenga mbali yolakwika, Jenberg anatero. "Mukayang'ana EU , mgwilizano wa mayiko a ku Europe ngati chimodzi, mgwilizano wa South Africa ndi EU ndi waukulu koposa. Ndiye ngati mutafuna kukamba za chuma,muzikamba izi mokhudzana ndi mayiko amu United States komanso mayiko aku Europe ndi umene ungabweretse phindu lambili la chuma."

eng: Whatever the motives, it has left Western nations siding with Ukraine disappointed, and experts warn there could be implications for South Africa in the future.
nya: Kaya cholinga ndi chani, ilo yasiya mbali ya mayiko a ku madzulo omwe ali mbali ya Eukrane atankhumudwa, ndipo anamandwa achenjeza patha kukhala zotsatira kwa South Africa mutsogolomu

eng: Ina Gouws is a political science lecturer at South Africas University of the Free State.
nya: Ina Gouws ndi mphunzitsi wa phunziro la Political Science ku sukulu ya ukachenjede ya ku South Africa ya Free State

eng: These kinds of things down the road, become problematic, Gouws said. "If you don't display that kind of cooperation and sound thinking, and firm condemnation when a country does something like this, down the road, it bites you when you need support from the international community."
nya: Zinthu ngati izi patsogolo zimabweretsa mavuto,Gouws anatero. Ngati siungaonetse mgwirizano otero komanso kuganiza bwino, ndi kutsutsa kosasunthuka pamene dziko lapanga kanthu ngati aka, kutsogolo, zimadzakuvuta pamene ukufuna thandizo lochokera kunja."

eng: While the ramifications for South Africa remain uncertain, experts agree its unlikely the country will change its position any time soon.
nya: Pamene zotsatira za mbali yomwe South Africa yatenga sizikudziwikabe, akatswiri akuvomereza kuti ndizosayembekezeka kuti dzikoli lisintha maganizo ake nthawi ina ili yonse pompano

eng: Interpol Issues Red Notices for Gupta Brothers Wanted in South Africa
nya: Interpol yapeleka uthenga pa dziko lonse kuti anyamata a banja la a Gupta akufunika ku South Africa

eng: South Africa said this week the International Criminal Police Organization, Interpol, has requested countries seek out and arrest Rajesh and Atul Gupta, two brothers and businessmen who allegedly bribed top officials, including former president Jacob Zuma, to gain lucrative government contracts.
nya: Dziko la South Africa lati bungwe la apolisi oyang'ana zifwamba la International Criminal Police Organisation , Interpol yapempha mayyiko asake komanso kumanga Rajeshndi Atul omwe ndi abanja limodzi komanso onse a mapanga ma bizinesi omwe akuganizilidwa kuti anapeleka ziphuphu akuluakulu a aboma kuphatikizapo mtsogoleri wa dziko wopuma a Jacob Zuma kuti apeze mgwirizano wa malonda a phindu lalikulu ndi boma.

eng: South African anti-corruption activists have accused the Guptas of "state capture," a term meant to describe the brothers' strong influence over former president Zuma and members of his Cabinet — influence that allegedly extended to contracts, policy and personnel choices.
nya: Anthu omenyerera kutha kwa zinyengo ku South Africa anena a kwa Gupta wa kuti 'analinjata boma' mawu ogwilitsidwa ogwiritsidwa ntchito pofuna kutanthauza kuti anyamatawa anali ndi mphamvu yaikulu pa tsogoleri wa dziko opuma a Jacob Zuma komanso nduna zake - machitachita omwe anasefukira ku migwirizano ya malonda, lamulo komanso zisankho za umunthu pa yekha

eng: While there are many allegations against the Guptas, the red notices — requests to member nations to arrest — were issued for a case involving a relatively small $1.5 million pertaining to procurement fraud.
nya: kugula makuba zazing'ono zokwana $1.5 million

eng: South Africa's National Prosecuting Authority requested the red notices last year, but Rajesh and Atul Guptas' lawyers objected. The application had to be reviewed by Interpol to make sure, among other things, that there was no political bias.
nya: Bungwe loyimba anthu ,ilandu mu dziko la South africa la National Prosecuting Authority linapempha ma uthenga a dziko lonsewa chaka chatha koma oimilira milandu wa Rajesh ndi Atu Gupta anatsutsa. Kupemphaku kumayenera kuunikidwa ndi Interpol kuti ionetsetse pa mwamba pa zinthu zinthu zina kuti panalibe kukondera (chifukwa cha ndale) kwina kuli konse.

eng: Interpol's ambassador for the Turn Back Crime Campaign, Andy Mashaile, said South Africa also took time to secure an extradition treaty with the United Arab Emirates, as it's believed the brothers are in Dubai.
nya: Kazembe wa Interpol kwa 'the Turn Back Crime Campaign' Andy Mashaile anatidziko la South Africa linatenga nthawi kuti lisunge mgwirizano ndi dziko la united Arab Emirates pakuti azichimwenewa ali ku Dubai.

eng: You can then go to Interpol Dubai and say: 'Interpol Dubai, we know this is the place where the guys are living, this is the street name and the street number, this is how they look, these are their images. Please help us get these people in your detention center or in your cell, in jail until we are able to fetch them from Dubai,' Mashaile said.
nya: mutha tsono kupita ku Interpol a ku Dubai ndikukanena kuti: 'Interpol Dubai, tikudziwa kuno ndi kumene anayamatawa akukhala ndipo nsewu wake dzina lake ndi ili komanso numbala ya nsewuwo ndi iyi, umu ndi momwe amaonekera, izi ndizo zithunzi zawo. Chonde tithandizeni tiwatenge anthu awa kosungirako anthu kapena ku ma selo anu, mu ndende mpaka titawatenga kuchokera ku Dubai, Mashaile anatero

eng: Interpol has 194 member countries and, while red notices do not compel them to execute arrests, the notices do help in tracking the whereabouts of suspects or fugitives. Their photographs are posted on all local law enforcement systems.
nya: Interpol ili ndi mayiko 194 omwe imagwirako ntchito ndipo pamene uthenga wa dziko lonse sumawakakamiza kumanga anthu, ma uthengawa amathandiza namlondora  odziwa komwe anthu oganizilidwawo or othawawo. Zithunzi zawo zimaikidwa mu ndondomeko yothandizira kusunga lamulo.

eng: Political analyst Sanusha Naidu of the Institute for Global Dialogue said the red notices could help the 2024 reelection campaign of South Africa's president, Cyril Ramaphosa, because it shows he is taking action against corruption.
nya: Katswiri wa za ndale Sanusha Naidu waku Global Dialogue anati ma uthenga a dziko lonse akanathandizira kukopa anthu pa kuponyanso voti kusankha mtsogoleri wa dziko la mu chaka cha 2024 , CyrilRamaphosa chifukwa zikuonetsa kuti akuchitapo kanthu potsutsana ndi katangale

eng: But I think what it also suggests is that at an international level, you know, getting the international community and, in particular, Interpol to also take a stance and align with the position that Ramaphosa has, Naidu said. "So, I think in terms of him moving forward and trying to say to the South African public, I'm doing what I have to do. I'm working around this, I'm moving the needle on this."
nya: Koma ndikuganiza kuti zomwe izi zikuonetsera ndi zakuti pa dziko lonse lapansi, mukudziwa inu, kupangitsa bungwe la dziko lonse la pansi makamaka la Interpol kuti litengepo gawo ndikulumikizana ndi ganizo lomwe Ramaphosa ali nalo, Naidu anatero. "Choncho ndikuganiza kuti iye popita patsogolo komanso poyesera kuwauza anthu a ku South Africa kuti ndikuchita zomwe ndikuenera kuchita. Ndikuzikoza izi, ndikulondoloza pa izi."

eng: However, Naidu said she's not sure it's enough to redeem the African National Congress, which has steadily been losing support at the polls because of rampant corruption and failure to deliver basic services.
nya: Komabe, Naidu anati alibe kutsinmikiza mtima kuti n'zokwanira kupulumutsa chipani cha African National Congress, chomwe chakhala pang'ono ndi pang'ono chikutaya awatsatira ku zisankhochifukwa cha ziphuphu zosatha  komanso kulephera kukwanilitsa zinthu zofunikira

eng: I think if you want to talk about what ordinary South Africans want, they want to see the judicial system take its natural course, she said. "But the question also is all the money that's been taken from the country, how does that come back? Because if you think about it, that's where part of the challenge lies."
nya: Ndikuganiza kuti ukafuna kukamba zofuna za mzika ya wamba ya dziko la South Africa,akufuna za malamulo ndi chilungamo chiyende momwe hcimayenerera, anatero iye. "Koma funso linanso ndi la kuti kodi ndalama zonse zobebdwa mudzikoli zimabwerera bwanji? Chifukwa mukaziganizira, pamenepo ndipamene pali povuta."

eng: News of the red notices broke a day before the release of the third report from the Inquiry into State Capture. It called for the National Prosecuting Authority to investigate Zuma. The former president refused to appear before the inquiry and was jailed for 15 months after defying a court order to do so. However, he was let out on medical parole soon after.
nya: Nkahni yokhudza uthenga opita dziko lonse la pansi inafika tsiku lomwe mawa lake kunatuluka uthenga wina pa kufufuza kwa kugwidwa kwa dziko. Izi zinaitanira pa National Prosecution Authority kuti amufufuze Zuma. Mtsogoleri wa kaleyu anakana kuonekera pakufufuzidwaku ndipo anakhala mu ndende kwa miyezi 15 atanyozera langizo labwalo la milandu. Komabe, anatulutsidwa kamba ka matenda zitangotha izi.

eng: Analyst: Release of Corruption Report a First Step in Repairing South Africa’s Democracy
nya: Katswiri: Release of Corruption Report a First Step in Repairing South Africa’s Democracy

eng: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa says a scathing report by an inquiry into state graft marks "the end of an era" of corruption. But analysts say it's only the beginning of efforts needed to restore public trust in South Africa's political institutions.
nya: Mtsogoleli w dziko la south Africa Ciyril Ramaphosa anati  uthenga ojamburidwa ndi ofufuza pa mulingo olumikizitsa zizindikiro, zakutha kwa nthawi ya chinyengo. Koma Katswiri anati ichi ndichiyambi chabe chomwe chidwi chikufunika pobwezeritsa chikhulupiliro cha anthu pa mabungwe andale amu dziko la South Africa.

eng: For more than three years, South Africans watched the public proceedings of a national inquiry into graft under the tenure of former President Jacob Zuma.
nya: Koposera zaka zitatu anthu a dziko la South Africa akhala akuonelera kupitilira kwa milandu ya dziko yofufuza dzikolo polumikizitsana ndi nthawi ya mtsogoleli opuma Jacob Zuma.

eng: Thats why its findings of systemic corruption released by Justice Raymond Zondo late Tuesday didnt come as a surprise.
nya: Ndi chifukwa chake zopeza zake za dongosolo la njira za chinyengo zoulutsidwa ndi Justice Raymond Zondo Lachiwiri madzulo sizinabwele ngati chodzidzimutsa.

eng: Instead, the public is waiting to see what comes next.
nya: Mmalo mwake anthu akudikira kuti awone kuti chibwelenso ndichani.

eng: Narnia Bohler-Muller is a professor with South Africas Human Sciences Research Council.
nya: Narnia Bohler-Muller ndimphunzitsi pa sukulu yaukachenjede ya ku  South Africa yotchedwa Human Science Research Council.

eng: Now people want to see consequences and accountability, she said. "People are losing trust in government and in democracy, so we don't want to go to a point beyond no return. I do really think that we may be saved by a response that is going to be a proper implementation plan and action. If that doesn't happen, then I dont know, then we will not be living in a democracy."
nya: Pakadali pano anthu akufuna aowone zotsatira zake komanso kuyankhapo, Iye anatero. Anthu akutaya chikhulupiliro ndi boma komaso mu ndale, ndiye sitikufuna  tifike pamalo povuta kubwelera.ndikuganiza kuti apa titha kupulumuka ndi yankho loti akhazikitsa dongosolo loyenera komanso kuchita.Ngati izi sizichitika , apo ndiye sindikudziwa, apo ndiye sitidzalakhala paufulu wa ndale

eng: She says public trust in government has been on the decline since 2009 — coinciding with Zumas time in office.
nya: anati chikhulupiliro cha anthu pa boma chakhala chikutsika kuyambira 2009 ndikudzakumana ndi nthawi ya ulamuliro wa Zuma

eng: The new report focused on corrupt contract tenders and political kickbacks in relation to South African Airways, the state revenue agency and public procurement.
nya: Uthenga watsopano ukulunjika pa migwirizano  yopelekera katundu mwachinyengo komanso kulandira ndalama mwa ndale mokhudzana ndi ku South African Airways, bungwe lotolera ndalama zaboma komanso ogula katundu wa boma.

eng: It recommended prosecution against former high-ranking lawmakers and their public and private sector affiliates.
nya: Inalangiza kuimba mlandu anthu ama udindo akuluakulu opanga malamulo komanso onse okhudzidwa nawo a m'boma komanso amene si a boma

eng: But charges may not come swiftly.
nya: Koma chigamulo sichingabwere mwachangu

eng: Olwethu Majola, a lawyer and doctoral candidate in criminology at the University of Cape Town, says further investigations need to take place.
nya: Olwethu Majola, oyimilira mlandu komanso ophunzira mwa u dotolo za uchifwamba pa sukulu ya ukachenjede yotchedwa University of Cape Town, anati kufufuza koonjezera kukuyenera kuchitika.

eng: We're going to see law enforcement, such as the police or special investigative unit, conducting their own investigations based on the preliminary commission. Depending on how far or how long it takes for investigations to be concluded, perhaps within, you know, two years, we can see charges being brought against individuals, she said.
nya: Tiona lamulo likugwira ntchito,mwachitsanzo a polisi kapena gulu lofufuza lapadera, likuchita kafukufuku wawo kuyambira ntchito yomwe inapangidwa koyambilira. Potengera kutalika kwa ulendo komanso kutalika kwa nthawi yomwe kafkufukuyu angathere, mwina pasanathe zaka ziwiri, titha kuona anthu akuzengedwa milandu

eng: Majola says the former president will be among those to face prosecution.
nya: Majola anati mtsogoleli opuma  akhala mmodzi mwa ozengedwa mlandu

eng: Zuma was already found guilty of contempt of court last year for failing to appear before the inquiry. He has long denied any wrongdoing and called the inquiry biased.
nya: Zuma anapezeka kale olakwa ponyozera langizo la bwalo la milandu chaka chatha polephera kudzaonekera ku bwaloli pasanayambe kafukufukuyu. Iye anakana kuti sanapange cholakwa chili chonse ndipo anati kafukufukuyu ndi okondera.

eng: Zuma maintains a loyal following of supporters who dont want to see the former leader imprisoned.
nya: Zuma akanali ndiomutsatira okhulupilika amene sakufuna kumuona mtsogoleri opumayu atamangidwa

eng: In addition to consequences, the inquiry has also made recommendations to prevent state graft, including the formation of an independent corruption agency.
nya: Pamwamba pa zotsatira, kafukufukuu wapeleka langizo popewa chinyengo, kuphatikizapo kupanga magulu oima pa okha opewa chinyengo (independent corruption agency)

eng: Richard Chelin is a senior researcher on organized crime for the Institute for Security Studies in South Africa.
nya: Richard Chelin ndi wamkulu wa a kafukufuku pa milandu yochita kuyikonza a Institute for Security studies ku South Africa

eng: The key question is political interference, she said. "How do you create a body that is so independent? How do you fund such a body? Which is very difficult. I think these are the struggles that a lot of the anti-corruption, that is faced globally — is how do you maintain independence? And who do they answer to?"
nya: Funso lofunika ndikosokonezedwa cifukwa cha ndale, iye anatero. "Mumalenga bwanji bungwe loima palokha?Kodi bungwe limeneli mumalithandiza ndi ndalama bwanji?Chomwe chili chovuta. Ndikuganiza kuti awa ndi mavuto ambili omwe olimbana ndi katangale  pa dziko lonse la pansi amakumana nawo ndi mungasunge bwanji bungwe likhalebe loima palokha? komanso kodi iwo amayankha kwa ndani?"

eng: The public still has months to wait for any government action. Two more reports from the inquiry will be released in the coming weeks.
nya: Anthu ali ndi miyezi yoti adikilire boma kuti lichitepo kanthu kalikonse. Ma uthenga ena awirikuchokera ku Kafukufuku atulutsidwa mu masabata akubwerawa.

eng: President Cyril Ramaphosa will then deliver the full report to parliament by the end of June before implementing its recommendations.
nya: Mtsogoleri Cyril Ramaphosa kenako apeleka uthenga wathunthu ku nyumba ya malamulo pakutha pa mwezi wa June asanakhazikitse zomwe alangiza.

eng: Man Accused of South African Parliament Fire Faces Terrorism Charge
nya: Munthu yemwe akuzengedwa mulandu waku South Africa Parliament Fire alandira chirango cha uchiugawenga.

eng: The South African man charged with arson for burning down large parts of the country's historic parliament buildings has also been charged with terrorism.
nya: Mzibambo wa dziko la South Africa walandira chirango pa mulandu wootcha  pomwe naotcha gawo lalikulu la nyumba yamalamulo yakale.

eng: Forty-nine-year-old Zandile Christmas Mafe made his second appearance in court Tuesday. He is now facing several charges related to the fire, including terrorism, arson, breaking and entering and theft.
nya: Zandile Christimas Mafe wa zaka 39 anakaonekera lachiwiri ku bwalo lamilandu. Akulandira  zilango zochuluka zokhudzana ndi moto, kuphatikiza uchigawenga, kuotcha, kuphwanya ndikulowa  komanso kuba.

eng: Mafe was arrested shortly after the fire erupted at the parliament buildings in Cape Town in the early hours of January 2nd.
nya: Mefa  anamangidwa moto utangoyamba kuyaka kumene pa nyumba yamalamulo mu Cape Town mmaora oyambilira apa 2 january.

eng: He was allegedly found with laptops, documents and crockery in his possession. Prosecutors now say he was also in possession of an explosive device, hence the additional terrorism charge.
nya: Iye mokakikilidwa anapezeka ndi malaputopu, zitupa ndi ziwiya zaku khitchini pakatundu yemwe anali naye,  woimba mulandu waboma pano akuti analinso ndi zipangizo zophulika, zomwe zikuonjezera chilango cha uchigawenga

eng: In his first court appearance his lawyer denied all charges against him.
nya: Mukuonekera kwake ku bwalo lamilandu omuimilira pamulanduwu anakana milandu yonseyi pa ozengedwayu.

eng: Mafe has since changed lawyers, and is now being represented by the famous Dali Mpofu, who is affiliated with the left-wing Economic Freedom Fighters political party.
nya: Mafe wakhala akusintha omuimilira pamulandu, ndipo pakadali pano akuimililidwa ndi Dali Mpofu omwe ndiotchuka,  yemwe wakhara akuthandizana ndi achipani cha ndale  cha Left-wing EconomicFreedom Fighters.

eng: Mpfou has also been representing the countrys former president Jacob Zuma, who was jailed for contempt of court.
nya: Mpofe wakharanso akuimilira mtsogoleli opuma wadziko Jacob Zuma, yemwe anamangidwa posalemekeza malamulo a bwalo lamilandu.

eng: Mafes bail hearing was postponed till the 11th of February and he will be detained in a psychiatric institute.
nya: Kumva madandaulo oti Mafe aziyendera mulandu  kuchokera kwawo kwasunthidwa mpakapa 11 February ndipo amangidwira ku bungwe losunga amisara.

eng: It was revealed that hed already been sent for psychiatric observation on January 3rd and was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia.
nya: Zaululika kuti anayambapo watumizidwanso kukayesedwa misara pa 3 January ndipo anapezeka ndimatenda amisara amu ubongo a paranoid Schizophrenia.

eng: The estimated damage to the parliament complex is just over 14 million U.S. dollars. That excludes the cost of moveable assets inside, like computers and furniture.
nya: Mulingo oyesezera kuonongeka kwa malo anyumba yamalamulo ndioposa 14 miliyoni  pa ndalama ya U.S dollars.  Pamenepo osaphatikizira ndalama za katundu osunthika wamkati, ngati makompyuta ndi mipando.
